Talk to me when you are ready for your final deed.

The small Heretic group you infiltrated wasn't our biggest concern. 
[variable:CAPTAIN] is out there, deeper into the wilds, waiting to attack a bigger gathering of these Heretics.
A fine young adventurer like you is exactly what he has been waiting for.
Report to him and gain glory!
Good luck, and a tight grip - time to show them who we Royals really are.

Look at that, yet another fledgling from the motherland, I bet the Commander sent you over.
All right, I will make a proper adventurer out of you. You will need to learn how to survive here in Albion, how to gather, how to craft.
Now, [playername], the first step is to choose a weapon.

Welcome to [variable:LOCATION_A], [playername]! Albion needs strong and adventurous folk like you.
This continent can be dangerous, though. Listen to me, your survival is in our and your best interest. Complete the Royal Training and we will reward you with a mighty [b]Royal Steed[/b]!
Start your training with [variable:CRAFTER].

Ahh, [playername], have you found [variable:CRAFTER] yet?
A big, red-headed fellow, with only one eyebrow. He should be close to the Toolmaker at the center of this settlement.
You can't miss him.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_COMMANDER_UN:
What a battle! Well done, [playername]! We could use more of your kind in the big city.

You are free to pursue whatever you fancy: Search for rare materials, fight monsters, help us in Expeditions or skirmish with other adventurers.

Find your destiny here in [b]Albion![/b]

We need someone with experience in this battle.
Someone who knows the enemy inside-out. 
I can see it in your eyes: you have the guts to become a Journeyman Reaver.
There are a huge number of Heretics just ahead of us. 
Go in there and wreak havoc until you unlock your inner Reaver!
How goes the battle? To see your progress, look at your Destiny Board. Your Fame is reflected on it.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_CRAFTER_CRAF: Now you are complete. A true adventurer. Fully equipped. [playername], you have done well.

You will need something to keep you from harm, [playername].
Armor will not only protect you in battle, but also support your fighting style.
You know everything you need about gathering and crafting. It is time to craft your armor.
You are what you wear, never forget that!
Second Skin
Now you are complete. A true adventurer. Fully equipped. [playername], you have done well.

You will need something to keep you from harm, [playername].
Armor will not only protect you in battle, but also support your fighting style.
You know everything you need about gathering and crafting. Time to craft your armor and an offhand item that suits your needs.
You are what you wear, never forget that!
Second Skin

That's what I call curves!
Very good craftsmanship, [playername], maybe you are good for something after all!

You are ready to craft your bow.
[playername], go to the Hunter's Lodge here in [variable:LOCATION_A] and craft your weapon!
What are you waiting for? Onward to the Hunter's Lodge, don't let the workbench wait!
Bow and Arrow

One can hear it crackling in the air, a truly powerful weapon.
You know your work, [playername], I am impressed.

You are ready to craft your fire staff.
[playername], go to the Mage's Tower here in [variable:LOCATION_A] and craft your weapon!
What are you waiting for? Onward to the Mage's Tower, don't let that strange, old man wait!
Staff and Fire

Ha! Will you look at this! I thought you were a lost cause.
What a sword! Very good work, [playername]. Maybe I can make something useful out of you after all!

You are ready to craft your sword.
[playername], go to the Warrior's Forge here in [variable:LOCATION_A] and craft your blade!
What are you waiting for? Onward to the Warrior's Forge, don't let the anvil wait!
Blade and Hilt
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_CRAFTER_GATH:
Could you feel the strength of the trees, [playername]?
You have gathered very promising birch logs. A good bow is like a good mind, strong yet flexible. Well done.

It is time to gather the resources for your weapon.
I, personally, would go to [variable:LOCATION_A]: there you will find birch wood. Get at least 32 logs. On your way now, a bow is waiting to be crafted.
[playername], did you gather all the resources needed for your bow?

You have collected fine ore and birch - well done, [playername]. I just wonder... how can wood and metal combined create fire and ice?
Magic is an odd thing.

It is time to gather the resources for your weapon. I, personally, would go to [variable:LOCATION_A]: there you will find copper ore. Get at least 8 lumps. At [variable:LOCATION_B] you should find enough trees to get 16 birch logs. On your way now, a fire staff is waiting to be crafted.
Did you gather all the resources needed for your fire staff, [playername]?
Nothing like the smell of fresh wood and hide. Fine materials for a fine sword. Well done [playername].

It is time to gather the resources for your weapon.
I, personally, would go to [variable:LOCATION_A]: there you will find copper ore. Get at least 16 lumps.
At [variable:LOCATION_B] you should find enough animals to get 8 rugged hide. On your way now, a sword is waiting to be crafted.
[playername], did you gather all the resources needed for your blade?
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_CRAFTER_GOTO:
Top of the day to ya! Welcome to my woods. I heard you want to make a bow! 
Just grand, let's find you some proper wood.

It is time to gather the resources for your weapon.
Go and find [variable:LUMBERJACK]. 
No one better to learn from when it comes to bark and trees.
On your way now, a bow is waiting to be crafted.

Do not be shy, [variable:LUMBERJACK] does not bite, he only chops! 
Go to the Lumbermill outside of this Outpost.
I am sure [variable:LUMBERJACK] is waiting for you there.

Top o' the day to ya! Welcome to my woods. I heard you want to make a staff! 
Just grand, let's find you some proper wood.

It is time to gather the resources for your weapon.
Go now, and find [variable:LUMBERJACK]. 
No one better to learn from when it comes to bark and trees.
On your way now, a staff is waiting to be crafted.

Do not be shy, [variable:LUMBERJACK] doesn't bite, he only chops! 
He is normally close to his Lumbermill.
I am sure [variable:LUMBERJACK] is waiting for you there.
Been waiting for you, [playername]. Hope you got your pickaxe ready - let's get some ore!

It is time to gather the resources for your weapon.
You should find [variable:MINER]. 
He is a tough one, and will teach you how to get what you need.
On your way now - a sword is waiting to be crafted.

[playername], have you found [variable:MINER] yet? 
He should be close to the Smelter.
New weapon, new armor, you must be one of the new ones. No more gathering, now we shall see what you are made of. Attention adventurer!

[playername], you have done well.
Time to prove your strength in battle. Go to [variable:SOLDIER], he will continue your training.

Missed me?
Or can't you find [variable:SOLDIER].
Just leave this town and look on your map - 
you should be able to see him on it. Good luck out there!
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_CRAFTER_LEAR: ...You actually held the map the right way up ... maybe you are not like the others. Remember, specific biomes feature specific resources. Knowing where to look - and where to go - can save you time... and also your life.

[playername], one of the most important tools you have in Albion is your map.
Knowing where you are and what is available in your vicinity is essential. You can't find all resources in all environments - every biome has its own native resources. For instance, you wouldn't search for stone in a swamp.
All the information you need is on your map.

Forest is where the trees hide wolves and rocks,
Steppe is full of fauna, ore and flora, a true sandbox,
Fiber is found in the swamp, between wood and frogs,
Highlands is a hard place, only stone, ore and logs,
While Mountains are high in metals and rock, but also fiber for your socks.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_CRAFTER_REFI:
As I thought, it's just beautiful. Strong, yet flexible. You have everything you need to create your bow.
[playername], find me when you are ready to continue your training.

[playername], there is one more step before we can craft your bow.
You will have to refine your birch logs at the Lumbermill. You can find the building here in [variable:LOCATION_A].
Have you refined your logs yet?

Look at those bars and planks, it almost feels like they are aware. Perfect materials for a fire staff.
Do tell me when you are ready for the next step [playername].

[playername], there is one more step before we can craft your fire staff.
You will have to refine your copper ore at the Smelter and birch logs at the Lumbermill. You can find both buildings here in [variable:LOCATION_A].
Have you refined your ore and logs yet?

Ore becomes bars, and hide becomes leather. There is nothing more satisfying than refining the rough. You have everything you need for your blade. 
Talk to me when you are ready to forge your weapon, [playername].

[playername], there is one more step before we can craft your sword.
You will have to refine your copper ore at the Smelter and your rugged hide at the Tanner. You can find both buildings here in [variable:LOCATION_A].
Have you refined your ore and hide yet?
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_CRAFTER_TOOL:
A bow is a precise, ranged weapon, a very good choice [playername].
You will need wood, and for that you will need an axe.

Do you have your axe yet?
Always remember [playername], good tools mean less work.

This looks fine, you've got everything you need, [playername].
Do not forget, if you want to gather other resources, then you will need different tools. You look like a strong person, I am sure you can carry one of every kind, if you wanted to.

A clever one, are we, [playername]? Magic is not for everyone; wood and ore will be required.
You'll need an axe and a pickaxe.

Do you have your axe and pickaxe yet?
Always remember, [playername], good tools mean less work.

The Sword is a solid choice, the tool of a soldier. [playername], you will need ore and hide to craft such a fine weapon.
For that you will need a pickaxe and a skinning knife.

Do you have your pickaxe and skinning knife yet?
Always remember, [playername], good tools mean less work.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_GOTO_MARKETP: Go back to town and search for a Royal Horse Token at the Marketplace.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_HUNTER_GATHE: What a kill, you got some nice fur there. You are ready for the next step. Approach me when you want to continue.

I see you are prepared. Good. You will have to find your prey and kill it.
After it's dead, divide its hide from its flesh. 
Come back when you have gathered 8 Rugged Hide.
Look for your prey close to woods, grass or water. Any Impala, Fox or Snake will do. Good Hunting!
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_HUNTER_GOTO_:
Welcome back! Look at you, a bit broader around the shoulders, a bit more tanned.
Starting to look proper. Well, well, it is time to craft your weapon.
Talk to me when you want to learn the secrets of smithing.

Go back to [variable:CRAFTER]. I've got nothing left that I can teach you [playername]. 
He will show you how to form a sword from metal and leather. May the wind always be in your favor.
I know it is hard to leave nature to go back to a settlement. But your sword is waiting for you. Go craft it. Good Luck!
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_HUNTER_REFIN:
Became a good hunter after all. I have to say, I am pleased with your skills. 
Talk to me when you want to start to make your weapon.

Fur is good and nice, but you're not making fashion here, but weapons. 
Take your Rugged Hide over to the Tannery close by and refine it.
Come back to me when you have 8 Stiff Leather.

You see the building with all the leather? 
That's the Tannery. Go there. Refine it. Come back.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_LUMBERJACK_G:
A job well done, I call that. A nice 32 logs. 
Ok then, If you are ready to continue your training, talk to me
and we shall make some nice planks.

So, [playername], every bow needs some proper planks of wood. 
Every plank needs to be refined from logs. 
Bring me 32 Birch Logs and I shall teach you how to get planks. 
Remember to grip your axe tightly!

Don't know what a Birch looks like?
Never worry, it has a pale and slightly spotted bark. 
Rather thin trees. I trust in your skills. Chop, chop!

A job well done, I call that. A nice 16 logs. 
Ok then, if you are ready to continue your training, talk to me
and we shall make some nice planks.

So, [playername], every staff needs some proper planks of wood. 
Every plank needs to be refined from logs. 
Bring me 16 Birch Logs and I shall teach you how to get planks. 
Remember to grip your axe tightly!

Don't know what a Birch looks like?
Don't worry: it has pale and slightly spotted bark. 
Rather thin trees. I trust in your skills. Chop, chop!

Welcome back! Look at you, a bit broader around the shoulders, a bit more tanned.
Starting to look proper. Well, well, it is time to craft your weapon.
Talk to me when you want to learn how to make a bow.

Your next step lies with [variable:CRAFTER] back in [variable:LOCATION_A]. I've got nothing left that I can teach you, [playername].
He will show you how to make wood into a bow. 
May your axe always be sharp!

One can't get enough of nature, right? 
But there is a bow to be made. 
Go craft one! [variable:CRAFTER] is surely waiting for you.
Been waiting for you, [playername]. Hope you got your pickaxe ready - let's get some ore!

I am proud to say that there is nothing more I can teach you. It is time to move on.
Time to find yourself a master of Ore, such as [variable:MINER]. 
He is a tough one, but a sweet one deep, deep inside.
On your way now, become the master of stick and stone!

[playername], have you found [variable:MINER] yet? 
He should be close to his Smelter.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_LUMBERJACK_R:
What a smell, beautiful isn't it. Freshly sawed wood. Now you are a lumberjack! 
Talk to me when you are ready to continue your training.

So, my friend. See that fellow over there with the big saw? 
He runs the Lumbermill. Go to him and refine your Birch Logs into Birch Planks. 
Return to me when you got 32 of 'em.
Haven't found the Lumbermill yet? It's right over there! On you go, chop chop!

What a smell! Beautiful, isn't it - freshly sawed wood. Now you are a lumberjack! 
Talk to me when you are ready to continue your training.

So, my friend. Do you see that fellow over there with the big saw? 
He runs the Lumbermill. Go to him and refine your Birch Logs into Birch Planks. 
Return to me when you got 16 of 'em.
Haven't found the Lumbermill yet? It's right over there! On you go, chop chop!
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_MINER_GATHER:
Ha! Well done!
I knew you would not be broken by the metal. 
Talk to me when you are ready to learn smelting.

Alright my friend, time to swing that pickaxe of yours. 
You will need 8 copper ore for your staff. Ore is strong here and breaks through the earth.
Have a look around, you should find plenty close by.

How is the ore hunt going? Copper is most common around here. 
Sticks right through the earth, two pointy veins!
Give that a good smack, and there you go.

Ha! Well done!
I knew you would not be broken by the metal. 
Talk to me when you are ready to learn smelting.

Alright my friend, time to swing that pickaxe of yours. 
You will need 16 copper ore for your sword. Ore is strong here and breaks through the earth.
Have a look around, you should find plenty close by.

How is the ore hunt going? Copper is most common around here. 
Sticks right through the earth, two pointy veins!
Give that a good smack with a pick, and there you go.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_MINER_GOTO_C:
Welcome back! Look at you, a bit broader around the shoulders, a bit more tanned.
Starting to look proper. Well, well, it's time to craft your weapon.
Talk to me when you want to learn the secrets of crafting a staff.

Go back to [variable:CRAFTER]. I've got nothing left that I can teach you [playername]. 
He will show you how to form a staff from wood and metal. May you always be as tough as ore.
Off with you, nothing more to learn here. Back with you to the town.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_MINER_GOTO_H:
There you are, welcome to the Hunt. 
This ain't as simple as hitting an unresisting rock here.
You will need to be more cunning in my domain. 
Speak with me when you are prepared for the hunt.

So far, so good. Now, you have to find [variable:HUNTER] - the ranger can be found close to his camp in [variable:LOCATION_A]. 
All you need to know about hide and leather, you will learn there.
Good Luck!
Off you go! Come on, [variable:HUNTER] has things to do and places to be. And you should be in [variable:LOCATION_A] at the Hide Station.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_MINER_REFINE:
Good work! That's how you get the best out of nature, burn it until it's pure.
I think you learned all you need to gather your materials. Talk to me when you are ready for you next step.

Sooo [playername], do you see that smelter close to me, the big chimney-looking thing? 
Take your copper ore there and refine it. 
Come back to me when you have 8 Copper Bars on you!

Come on! You won't burn yourself, just toss it in there and watch it melt! 
Nothing more beautiful in the world.

Good work! That's how you get the best out of nature, burn it until it's pure.
Your journey through the world of gathering is not over yet - talk to me when you are ready.

Sooo [playername], do you see that smelter close to me, the big chimney-looking thing? 
Take your copper ore there and refine it. 
Come back to me when you have 16 Copper Bars on you!

Come on! You won't burn yourself, just toss it in there and watch it melt! 
Nothing more beautiful in the world.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_SELECT_OPTIO: The Broadsword is the perfect weapon for everyone who loves straightforward combat. This is the start of all heavy weaponry, ranging from two-handed hammers to heavy crossbows.
A weapon of many uses, slowing and poisoning opponents. This is a weapon for agile fighters. Everyone who wants to become a ranger, assassin, spear fighter or druid should start out with this weapon.
The Fire Staff is a weapon of pure damage and control. Ranged combat and areas of effect are its speciality. Everyone who wants to become a mage, cleric or master of the arcane starts here.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_SOLDIER_GOTO:
There you are again, [playername].
You are ready to face the world and its dangers. Take this mighty steed - you have earned it.
You are now free to pursue whatever goal takes your fancy. Search for rare materials, fight monsters, or skirmish with other adventurers.
Find your destiny here in Albion!

There you are again [playername]. 
Take this mighty steed, you've earned it! 
Now that you are battle-proven and have a magnificent mount, 
you are ready for your final task in the name of the Royal Army.

Well done, [playername]!
You have reached the end of your training. There is only one more thing I can teach you.
Nothing is free! Everything takes hard work. Show us that you have earned your place among us.
Use the Silver you got from the Heretics and buy a Royal Horse Token from the Marketplace!
Report back to [variable:COMMANDER]. DISMISSED!

Your training with me is complete, [playername]!
You can get the everything you need from the Marketplace. They will also sell you a Royal Horse Token.
Off with you now, acquire the Token and talk to the Commander. DISMISSED!
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_SOLDIER_KILL:
Ah, your gaze has shifted.
You have tasted blood and Silver. That is what Albion is made of.
You make the King proud!

Attention, [playername]!
'Tis a dangerous land, and many things out there want to kill you.
For example, the Heretics! Scrawny, wild and crazy folk they are, evil to the bone. 
[variable:LOCATION_A] needs your support! Go kill Heretics and take their Silver. Report back to me as soon as you have obtained a decent amount. Dismissed!

You won't find any Heretics in here, [playername]!
Go out into the world and find their camps, they should be clearly marked on your map. Now go and fight for honour and for the King!
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_ROYAL_TOKEN_TO_COM: Bring the Royal Horse Token to [variable:COMMANDER].
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT_COMPL: "Not too bad, was it? But just between us, there are better ways to get some Fame and Silver. Are you ready for the real world?"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT_OFFER:
"Combat is my speciality, though nowadays I tend to let others do the fighting.
The fastest and safest way to get into the action is Expeditions.
Find the Expedition Master and offer your aid!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT_PROGR: "Expeditions are safe and offer small rewards."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT2_COMP: "Not so easy that time, was it? But I'm guessing it was worth it! You can find dungeon entrances all over Albion, or use a map to reveal a hidden one. Those maps can be purchased at the Marketplace for a bit of a sum."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT2_OFFE: "The real Fame is in the open world. Let's see, where did I put that... ah, here it is! Take this map; it will lead you to a dungeon. But first, you may want to get some better equipment. Come back once you've cleared out that dungeon!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT2_PROG: "Open-world dungeons offer vastly more Fame and rewards than Expeditions do."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT2_SIDE: Use Learning Points or kill mobs to unlock Tier 3 armors.
Use Learning Points or kill mobs to unlock Tier 3 weapons.
Get a Tier 3 (Journeyman's) Two-Handed Weapon or Main- and Off-Hand.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT3_COMP: Well done! There are many dungeons, keeps, and other places in Albion that are worth exploring with a party. I don't think there is much more to learn here - the big city, that's where you should go next.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT3_OFFE:
One of the old keeps has been overrun by Heretics.
But these ones are tough, very tough.
You could try your luck alone, but I strongly suggest you find other adventurers to aid you.
Either ask for help here in the city, or head to the keep and find adventurers there.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT3_PROG:
Taking on that keep alone might be too challenging.
Try to find other adventurers that can help you in your quest.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEACH_COMBAT3_SIDE: Go to the Heretic Keep (Suggested Party Size: 2+)
Kill one of the Heretic leaders
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_A_COMPLETIONT:
"Another survivor! I'm glad you survived the attack unharmed.
I wasn't so lucky - broke my arm when the explosion threw us overboard.
I don't know what happened to the others."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_A_OFFERTEXT:
You remember the taste of salt and burning wood...
Has your ship been attacked?
Is this Albion?
Where are the others...?
[b]You need to get to higher ground.[/b]
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_A_PROGRESSTEX:
You remember the taste of salt and burning wood...
Has your ship been attacked?
Is this Albion?
Where are the others...?
[b]You need to get to higher ground.[/b]
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_A_SIDETEXT: Find a way off the beach.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_A1_SIDETEXT: Get to a vantage point. Stay in the circle for
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_B_COMPLETIONT:
"So the ship is stranded nearby but the path is blocked by four bandits?
They're probably [b]Heretics[/b] - crazed and dangerous outlaws."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_B_OFFERTEXT:
"Let's gauge our situation. This tower seems like a good lookout. 
Climb up there and find out what happened to our ship."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_B_PROGRESSTEX: "Climb the tower, look for the ship."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_B4_SIDETEXT: Use the "Sprint" ability by pressing its button.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_C_COMPLETIONT:
"Good, this looks like something we can use.
The sword won't be pretty, but it doesn't need to be pretty to cut through Heretics."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_C_OFFERTEXT:
"These [b]Heretics[/b] will curse the day they shot at us.
You'll need a weapon, friend.
I am sure we can craft you a crude sword.
Bring me some logs and stone."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_C_PROGRESSTEX:
"Rough Stone and Rough Logs can be found everywhere.
I never thought my life would depend on them..."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_C_SIDETEXT: Find Rough Stone and Rough Logs.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_D_COMPLETIONT:
"This will do, good work.
Here, take my shield, you need it more than I do.
Are you ready to face them?"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_D_OFFERTEXT:
"Give the resources to the Blacksmith.
He will help you craft your weapon."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_D_PROGRESSTEX:
"See the strong lad to my left?
He is a capable blacksmith.
Go and see what he can do."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_D2_SIDETEXT: Open your Inventory by pressing the glowing button.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_D4_SIDETEXT: Select a spell on your sword.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_E_COMPLETIONT:
"I will lead the wounded to the ship as soon as the way is free.
See you on the other side, [playername]."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_E_OFFERTEXT:
"Those Heretics messed with the wrong crew. How I wish I could give them a sound thrashing!
[playername], you'll have to do it in my stead.
Raise shield and sword and give them hell. "
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_E_PROGRESSTEX:
"I will lead the wounded to the ship as soon as the way is free.
See you on the other side, [playername]."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_E_SIDETEXT: Go to the gate and get ready for the fight.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_E2_SIDETEXT: Kill the rest of the Heretics on the bridge.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_E3_SIDETEXT: Get to the ship and find the rest of the crew.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_F_COMPLETIONT:
"You made short work of that Heretic scum! Bloody well done.
You're [playername], aren't you? Thought I saw you on board....

Anyway, my ship is damaged, this bloody island isn't even Albion, and the Heretics control the sea passage.
So we're doing great!

I'm Tia, of course - Captain Tia."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_F_OFFERTEXT:
"Time to get rid of those fools.
How I wish I could give them a sound thrashing!
[playername], you'll have to do it in my stead.
Raise shield and sword and give them hell. "
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_G_SIDETEXT: Take a closer look at the ship.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_G1_SIDETEXT: Interact with the ship to see what is missing.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_H_COMPLETIONT:
"[playername], thanks for your help. Never introduced myself properly, did I?

[b]My name is [variable:CRAFTER].[/b]

There is much to be done, but I'll help in any way I can."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_H_OFFERTEXT:
"We need to repair my ship if we ever want to leave this island.
Wood, leather, metal and cloth are what we need.
[variable:CRAFTER] can teach you how and where to get them.
But first, get yourself a [b]mount from the Marketplace[/b] - trust me, you'll do a lot of walking!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_H_PROGRESSTEX:
"You'll be doing a lot of traveling, and traveling is always better if you're sitting.

Go see [variable:CRAFTER] next.
Oh, and the folks from the lighthouse made it here in one piece, thanks to you."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_H1_SIDETEXT: Buy a mount at the Marketplace.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_H2_SIDETEXT: Open your inventory and equip the shield.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_H4_SIDETEXT: Collect the mount from the Marketplace.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_I_COMPLETIONT:
"You will need specific tools for specific resources.

Never forget that."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_I_OFFERTEXT:
"Let's get this started, shall we, [playername]?
Firstly you'll need a pickaxe and an axe to gather higher-tier resources.
Go to the Toolmaker and find out what you need to craft the tools."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_I_PROGRESSTEX:
"The Toolmaker is a friendly chap, though a bit too stuck-up for my taste.
Look into his inventory to see what you need to craft an axe and a pickaxe."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_I_SIDETEXT: Go to the Toolmaker and learn what you need to craft a pickaxe and an axe.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_I1_SIDETEXT: Go to the Toolmaker to see what you need to craft.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_J_COMPLETIONT:
"My map has saved me a lot of time, and also saved my life a few times.

Know where you are going and what you are doing!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_J_OFFERTEXT:
"Your map is a valuable ally out there. Learn to use it!
It can tell you which dangers you'll face, what sort of resources you'll find, and what the best escape route might be."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_J_PROGRESSTEX:
"Study your map!

Would I leave my house without a map?
HA, are you kidding me?"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_J1_SIDETEXT: Open the World Map by pressing the button.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_K_COMPLETIONT: "Good work, [playername], you are getting the hang of this."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_K_OFFERTEXT:
"If we want to get the ship seaworthy again, we'll need wood, leather, iron and cloth for the repairs.
Let's start with wood and leather.
You should find birch trees and foxes aplenty in the nearby forest."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_K_PROGRESSTEX:
"Use your map to navigate as you collect resources.

Birch trees are white with dark spots on their bark.
I saw plenty of foxes earlier, they have good pelts."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_K3_SIDETEXT: Return to the camp and talk to Silas.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_K4_SIDETEXT: Find and gather Rugged Hide from foxes.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_K5_SIDETEXT: Go into the mountains and gather ore and fiber.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_KA_COMPLETION:
"Must've been cold up there!
But you got everything we need - a task well done.
Time to refine these raw materials."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_KA_OFFERTEXT:
"You'll be going after ore and fiber next.
Both can be found in the mountains.
I will mark the path up there on your map.
At least neither ore nor fiber will bite, aye?"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_KA_PROGRESSTE:
"Ore is always close to big rocks, and fiber is usually close to water.
Remember that!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L_COMPLETIONT:
"She floats... barely.
We can't take another bombardment like that...
We'll have to find out from where they are guarding the sea passage, so we can get off this damned island!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L_OFFERTEXT:
"You'll need refined resources if you want to craft anything.
Let's get your raw materials into shape.

The refiners from our crew should be able to help you out.
Bring your materials to them."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L_PROGRESSTEX:
"The Lumberjack is a bit simple, so speak slowly.
The Smelter is a fine lad, don't be too tough on him.
The Weaver is kind of our mum, always looks out for us.
Try to keep your distance from the Tanner,
if you want to keep your sense of smell."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L_TRADETEXT: "Ah, perfect - exactly what we needed. We'll have this ship fixed up in no time!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L1_SIDETEXT: Refine your Copper Ore at the Smelter.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L10_SIDETEXT: Bring your resources to the crane.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L2_SIDETEXT: Refine your Rugged Hide at the Tanner.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L3_SIDETEXT: Refine your Birch Logs at the Lumbermill.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L4_SIDETEXT: Refine your Cotton Fiber at the Weaver.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L5_SIDETEXT: Use the Copper Bars to repair the ship.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L6_SIDETEXT: Use the Stiff Leather to repair the ship.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L7_SIDETEXT: Use the Birch Planks to repair the ship.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L8_SIDETEXT: Use the Simple Cloth to repair the ship.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_L9_SIDETEXT: Use your resources to repair the ship.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_MA_COMPLETION:
"This map is brilliant! A complete layout of their fort.
So this is where their cannons are... and their ammunition...
I have an idea. It's high time to get you geared up.
We will need to strike - soon!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_MA_OFFERTEXT: "I marked an enemy outpost on your map. Go there and look for plans, maps, anything that might help us. And [playername], while you are there, practice your combat skills!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_MA_PROGRESSTE: "No one messes with Captain Tia and her crew and gets away with it!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_MA1_SIDETEXT: Go to the outpost in the forest and steal the Heretic map.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_MA2_SIDETEXT: Kill Heretics until you reach the Learning Point Threshold of the Trainee Combat Node.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_MA3_SIDETEXT: Unlock the Trainee Combat Node with Learning Points.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_N_SIDETEXT: Open your Destiny Board by pressing the button.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_N1_SIDETEXT: Learn about the Destiny Board Tracker.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_N3_SIDETEXT: Kill Heretics to unlock the Trainee Fighter node on your Destiny Board.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_N5_SIDETEXT: Find out more about their lair.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_NA_COMPLETION:
"[playername], have you decided what you want to use?
Be smart about it, play to your strengths."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_NA_OFFERTEXT:
"You'll need to be more powerful to infiltrate that fort of theirs.
[b]Novice armor and weapons[/b] will make you stronger.
There were some fine crafters and salespeople on the ship...
Have a look around and see what they have to offer."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_NA_PROGRESSTE:
"Your gear dictates who you are.
Choose it carefully. Balance your strengths and your weaknesses."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_NA1_SIDETEXT: Go to the Warrior's Forge and see what you can craft there.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_NA2_SIDETEXT: Go to the Hunter's Lodge and see what you can craft there.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_NA3_SIDETEXT: Go to the Mage's Tower and see what you can craft there.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O_COMPLETIONT:
"My, my... now you are ready to fight.
These [b]Heretics[/b] messed with the wrong crew!
Time to turn the tide!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O_OFFERTEXT:
"Choose your weapons and armor wisely!
You know how to gather resources, and how to craft weapons.
On your right you can find the finest crafters that haven't made it to Albion yet.

You can also just buy equipment with coin you make by selling items or killing enemies."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O_PROGRESSTEX:
"You know how to gather resources, craft weapons, and get silver.

Choose your gear, buy or craft the pieces.
Come back to me once you are equipped."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O1_SIDETEXT: Craft or buy Tier 2 head armor.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O10_SIDETEXT: Visit the Marketplace and look at the offers.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O2_SIDETEXT: Craft or buy Tier 2 chest armor.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O3_SIDETEXT: Craft or buy Tier 2 foot armor.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O4_SIDETEXT: Craft or buy a Tier 2 cape.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O5_SIDETEXT: Craft or buy a Tier 2 Main- and Offhand or Two-Handed Weapon.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O6_SIDETEXT: Visit the Crafting Buildings and see what you can craft there.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O7_SIDETEXT: Visit the Hunter's Lodge and see what you can craft there.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_O8_SIDETEXT: Visit the Mage's Tower and see what you can craft there.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P_COMPLETIONT:
"What a battle! Well fought, [playername]!
It is time to get you to Albion!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P_OFFERTEXT:
"Plan: You will stir up some chaos and we will sail right past their base.
Slaughter a few men, set fire to their ammunition storage, you know the drill.
Light the signal fire when you are done and [b]meet us at the pier in the fort.[/b]
See you on the other side, [playername]."
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P_PROGRESSTEX:
"Slaughter a few men, set fire to their ammunition storage and [b]meet us at the pier in the fort.[/b]

Distract them while we get the ship in place.
Then we can get to Albion!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P_SIDETEXT: Create a distraction by killing Heretics.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P1_SIDETEXT: Find the Heretic Fort in the mountains.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P5_SIDETEXT: Meet up with Tia to leave the island.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P6_SIDETEXT: Create further chaos by setting fire to their ammunition storage.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_P7_SIDETEXT: Call the ship by lighting a signal fire.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_Q_OFFERTEXT:
I owe you one, [playername]!

Talk to my navigator, he will show you where we can take you.
Onward to Albion!
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_Q_PROGRESSTEX:
"Stop messing around, there are still Heretics on our tail! You know that, right?
Talk to my first mate!"
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIAL_TEST_Q_SIDETEXT: Talk to the first mate and pick a destination.
@MISSIONS_T2_TUTORIALCOMBAT4_ANY_HERETIC: Kill any 10 Heretics or 1 Heretic Boss.
@MISSIONS_T3_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_HERETIC_GE: Those damned Heretic mages keep setting fire to our wagons. Go teach them a lesson - and try not to take a dagger in the back while you're at it!
Last patrol came back without any eyebrows - close call there!
Every time we step outside the walls, we get peppered with arrows - and even if we hit one of the bastards, they're back on their feet in a trice. Go and cause some more permanent damage, would you?
I hope you remembered your shield?
OK, the captain's getting fed up with Heretics harassing our convoys, and he wants to see results. Get out there and kill anything that moves.
I can still see- oh wait, that was a rabbit.
@MISSIONS_T3_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_PROMOTION_: You've demonstrated at least some minimal competence. Take this to [variable:AGENT_A] and you might get some more interesting work.
You have the letter of recommendation?
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_1:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Patrols need better bows, also other hand implements for when they're feeling brave.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_2:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Old leathers smell too much to be used.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_3:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

More equipment for patrols, their routes are becoming more and more dangerous
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_1_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Need range of staffs for training mages in different kinds of magic.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_1_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_2_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Bloody moths!
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_2_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_3_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Equipment for patrolling mages. They patrol in the dark mainly.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_3_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_1_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Patrols need capes to stay dry, and bags to collect firewood.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_2_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Need tools to collect resources to build watchtowers in remote new settlements.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_3_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Old tools are all blunt. Couldn't skin a stick of butter with this knife!
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_WARRIOR_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Provide selection of weapons for recruits. Back in my day we got a sword and we liked it. Kids these days don't know how good they have it.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.

The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Replacement armor needed for patrols, damp causing rust in existing equipment, and general misery.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.

The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Increasing patrol sizes to newer areas on the continent so need more equipment!
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T3_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_BUILDIN: If we want to equip our patrols properly, we're going to need to upgrade our military buildings to make better gear. Get out there and gather wood and stone to improve facilities.
You'll need more common resources as well if you want to upgrade something, mind.
@MISSIONS_T3_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_HUNTER_: You know why Hunters are great on patrol? Because they know what being on the other side of the fence is like. Gather some resources to make bows and leather armour, so we can put their skills to good use.
You're going to need to kill some wolves, by the way. Hope you're prepared for that!
@MISSIONS_T3_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_MAGE_1_: We need you to conjure some resources for our mages... Ha! Do you see what I did there? Because they use magic? Well, I thought it was funny.
Of course you can't actually 'conjure' resources - you have to go out and gather them yourself. By hand. Sorry. But you know about the circle of production, right? You've got this.
@MISSIONS_T3_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_PROMOTI: You've demonstrated at least some minimal competence. Take this to [variable:AGENT_A] and you might get some more interesting work.
You have the letter of recommendation?
@MISSIONS_T3_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_TOOLS_1: If we're going to sustain this pace of production, we're going to need more tools - and for that, we need more wood and more ore! Go out and harvest some, so we can keep on schedule.
Life would be much easier if tools didn't wear out over time...
@MISSIONS_T3_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_WARRIOR: Warriors are brave, bold, valiant... er... other words like that. They're also pretty damn reckless. Get us some ore and hide and fiber so we can whip them up some armor that can protect them from themselves...
The amount of them I've seen running headlong into trees... Killed one of them once!
@MISSIONS_T3_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_HEAV: There's a shipment of oil here for our boys and girls patrolling the outlands. The poor buggers work day and night, rain or shine. Give them something to burn on a campfire or lanterns, for some small comfort.
Creature comforts are few and far between on the remote patrols!

We're running a bit low on liquid refreshment for the troops, and it's vital for morale that we keep supplies topped up. Luckily I've managed to source some totally legit substitute - just read the label, it's "natural" and "enriched", so it's gotta be good, right?
No, I don't know what it's actually enriched *with*...

Our rations chef has devised a special dish for the patrols; chilled pig fat chowder with freshly grated tree bark. Its making was the most abominable horror I have ever witnessed, but it has all the nutrients a marching guard needs. Deliver these barrels of it to our logistics people, and... don't breathe near it.
Have you delivered the chowder yet? The troops will be so grateful...
@MISSIONS_T3_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_LIGH: You've probably noticed already that it can get a little chilly at night? Some of our night sentries are getting so cold they're falling asleep at their posts, and we can't have that. I need you to deliver these animal furs to keep them awake and alert.
Yes, we noticed the smell too, but we figured it'd help keep them awake.

Psst! Listen, I have a package I have to get to a friend of mine, but I need it done in complete secret. I'd do it myself but too many people know my face 'round here. Get it done quickly and cleanly and I'll trust you enough to give you more... interesting work in the future.

Has the bird landed yet? The bird, landed... you - the package is the bird, and you dropping it off is the landing. The bird... just - never mind! I mean have you delivered the package yet? Actually, I don't want to know. It might implicate me. Go away!
We need these maps of patrol routes distributed to the guards, with the utmost care I must add. These mustn't fall into the hands of highwaymen or raiders, or, gods forbid, the Heretic pests!
No, you're supposed to deliver the patrol routes, not follow them yourself!
@MISSIONS_T3_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_PROM: You've demonstrated at least some minimal competence. Take this to [variable:AGENT_A] and you might get some more interesting work.
You have the letter of recommendation?
@MISSIONS_T4_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_KEEPER_BOS: The lady with the axe, we want her gone. She's putting the fear of hell into my troops - well, that and the fear of losing an arm! The male troops are even worried about going for a piss... She's got to be stopped!
I come out in a cold sweat just thinking about it sometimes!

The chief savages can break a skull with a single swing of their hammers. Lives snuffed out in a single moment. They're thinning our ranks far too quickly; we need the threat dealt with now, not later.
It's a bloody horror for troop morale to see them all go so quickly...
@MISSIONS_T4_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_KEEPER_GEN: We're finding outposts torn down in the area, and there always seem to be axe marks all over the ruins. Find out who's responsible and demonstrate our displeasure.
And by 'demonstrate our displeasure' I mean 'kill them all', of course.
Private Cotton claims his entire patrol was butchered by cross-eyed madmen. Captain wants someone to go and look into it, and it looks like you drew the short straw this time.
Between you and me, I suspect Private Cotton may be making it all up.
Our people keep getting killed by maniacs, but they're suspiciously well-organized. There's got to be someone else directing them. Find out who, and ask them nicely to stop.
I hope you understood the subtext there. Here, let me spell it out: IF THEY DON'T STOP, KILL THEM ALL. Clear? Good.
@MISSIONS_T4_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_PROMOTION_: You've demonstrated at least some minimal competence. Take this to [variable:AGENT_A] and you might get some more interesting work.
You have the letter of recommendation?
@MISSIONS_T4_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_UNDEAD_BOS: There's a right sharpshooter in the midst of the undead - well, I suppose they have had two lifetimes to practice... We need them got rid of, we can't make any kind of push on the crypts until they're gone!
Hopefully we'll be able to make it through now that we're not losing an eye or two every time we try...

The Deathlords of the Undead have some ancient ability, honed over centuries, trained in this world and the next... The ability to scare the pants off my troops! Get them out of the way, the new recruits can't fight when their thighs are chafing with their own piss!
It's not like we need any more obstructions to good hygiene up here...

The Lieutenants of the Undead just march around aimlessly, like they're looking for their lost troops. I almost feel sorry for them. But then I think about how many of us they've killed. Put them out of their misery, will you?
The burden of a lieutenant... To have all of those lives on your shoulders. It's a dark place to stick a soul for eternity.
@MISSIONS_T4_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_UNDEAD_GEN: We've had worrying reports of the dead rising from their graves and living again. Also, battling again. Head over to some graveyards and see... well, see if they can die again?
Just keep hitting them, I'm told that's the trick.

The bad news is that the dead are rising from their graves, and the worse news is they seem to be somewhat militant. Your orders are to head out and destruction-test their tactics, see if they've got any surprises up their sleeves.
I'll be honest, I'm not expecting you to find that they're military geniuses. But we need to be sure!
The Captain has a theory that, if the Undead are animated by magic, killing their mages might cause them all to collapse. Go and test that, would you?
I can't say I'm optimistic about this one, but Captain's orders...
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_1:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Replacing losses from wear and tear due to endless training exercises.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_2:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Troops wish to experiment with alternative weaponry.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_3:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Farms have rats. Rats eat leather. You do the math.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_1_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Need replacement staffs, old ones are worn out. Keep misfiring. Nasty business.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_1_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_2_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Wish to acquire some advanced staffs for skilled mages.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_2_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_3_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Require more comfortable armor. Also more reading material.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_3_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_1_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Dear sir/madam, I hope this finds you well. My master has asked me to acquire more bags and capes, and this necessitates the completion of this requisition form detailing the reasoning for my needing more bags and capes. Yours Sincerely, George.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_2_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Need tools for building walls and fences. No, not just around my gardens. I'm going to use them to help others, too!
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_3_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Need general implements to facilitate destruction of wildlife for the good of humans.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_WARRIOR_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

If you're going to make my girls and boys stand around all day guarding a damn farm, the least you can do is give them decent equipment.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.

The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Why do you *think* I want more weapons? To make handkerchiefs?'
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.

The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

I need some armor. For my troops. I hate paperwork.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T4_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_BUILDIN: Food is our priority right now: we need fields, mills, butchers and so on. Lots of infrastructure needs building, and we need YOU to gather wood and stone to help with that. So go on, get out there and chop slash mine delete as appropriate.
Everybody's gotta eat, right? In fact I- I'm hungry right now!
@MISSIONS_T4_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_HUNTER_: Hunters tend to be particularly sharp-eyed, which makes them great at watching out for trouble. Gather resources for some Hunter equipment so we can mount a proper watch on our storehouses.
Yep, they're sharp-eyed all right. And interestingly, they don't eat much. Perfect for the job!
@MISSIONS_T4_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_MAGE_1_: A bit of magic would beef up our agricultural defenses - nothing says "don't steal that" like a good old-fashioned fireball to the face. But... we'll need resources to produce their equipment, of course. That's your job today.
Actually, now that I think about it, it's possible that throwing fireballs around on a farm isn't the greatest idea...
@MISSIONS_T4_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_PROMOTI: You've demonstrated at least some minimal competence. Take this to [variable:AGENT_A] and you might get some more interesting work.
You have the letter of recommendation?
@MISSIONS_T4_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_TOOLS_1: To run proper farms, we're going to need a good selection of tools. Which will require resources, which will be gathered by you. Right? Right.
If we treat our farmyard beasts like royalty, they'll bring us sovereign produce. No, I'm not making a joke about the King.
@MISSIONS_T4_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_WARRIOR: Some stout warriors to protect our food stores would be a good idea, no? And for that, we need ore and hide. Off you toddle, collect some up. Thank You kindly!
Wouldn't want anyone applying a five-finger discount to our wares, after all. Or a five-sack discount, for that matter.
@MISSIONS_T4_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_HEAV: The farmers need tools to keep the animals healthy; rasps for trimming hooves, hammers and chisels for shoeing... all of which can coincidentally also be used for preparing cheese! Ah, those farmers are resourceful.
There's a bit of a taste but you get used to it.
I need you to take this giant pile of ripe manure to a farm somewhere. Now, please.
I don't care which farm, so long as it's a long way away.

There's reports that crows have been decimating the farms they're trying to get going up north. These are some shirts and doublets from last year; apparently they're no longer in vogue back home, so they can be used for dressing scarecrows. Deliver them to my colleague for distribution.
You know there's actually someone who styles and dresses these scarecrows? That's a job someone is paid real money to do.
@MISSIONS_T4_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_LIGH: We've had reports of rat infestations at some of the smaller farms in the west, so I need you to take these semi-feral kittens we...er, acquired, and deliver them to the farmers. So yes, you're carrying a bag of kittens. Enjoy.
These kittens are vicious, you understand, not meant for pets - and I'll know if you take one.

Right, be careful with these; they're very delicate... and, well, there's a distinct buzzing noise coming from inside, we reckon there's a few live ones in there. When you've delivered them, you can rest proud in the knowledge that you ensured the king and his courtiers can have a bit of honey in their tea of a morning. Ah... It's a valiant war we're fighting.
The farms in the east get freezing at night; the poor cows who happened to get shipped over there are suffering! Get this hay over to them so we can keep them nice and warm and... alive.
Apparently their milk's freezing in their udders! Nasty way to go...
@MISSIONS_T4_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_PROM: You've demonstrated at least some minimal competence. Take this to [variable:AGENT_A] and you might get some more interesting work.
You have the letter of recommendation?
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_KEEPER_PROMOTION_1_O: You have served Albion well, friend. Take this token to [variable:AGENT_A], that you may serve further.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_KEEPER_PROMOTION_1_P: Service does the land honour, friend.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_BOSS_1: A talented archer of old is now training his bow on our peaceful hunting parties. This threat must be removed; we cannot lose another soul to it.
Is the deed done, friend? Can we enter the night unshielded once more?
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_BOSS_2: The Deathlords bring death to this land. Their mists shrivel mighty trees and turn beautiful flowers wizened and gray. Nothing can live while they poison the earth. Relinquish their hold on this sacred life!
Wrest Albion from their grasp, before it's too late!
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_BOSS_3: The Lieutenants yearn to lead, to protect, to be followed; they do not understand that their troops are gone, either travelled to the world beyond, or awakened, and hopelessly pursuing the traces of their old selves. Assuage their yearning for battle.
To ride into war once more... That is their only wish. A great and noble death.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_GENERI: These Undead soldiers persist in digging holes in the ground. Do they perhaps seek more of their comrades? No matter, they disturb things that should not be disturbed. Stop them.
How goes the fight? Is the silent earth free from Undead machinations?
I have directed my people to keep their distance from the Undead, but their archers and mages continue to harass us. Please, for their own good, dissuade them.
What need has a walking skeleton of magic, anyway?
Much as we would like to leave them in peace, the Undead in this area risk disturbing something... something that they should not. Drive them away before something unpleasant happens.
There are darker things here than the risen dead.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_MORGANA_PROMOTION_1_: You have helped us dull the ache of the Undead horde. Take this note of recommendation to [variable:AGENT_A], and my thanks.
Continue to serve Morgana, outsider, and you could soon find yourself brought among her Knights.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_MORGANA_UNDEAD_BOSS_: Their arrows cannot pierce our armor, but they know where to shoot for uncovered flesh; the neck, the groin, the grooves of our helms. Our knights bleed to death before they know they've been hit. Make sure you give them the same slow fate.
I want them to feel their stolen half-lives drain from them slowly.

Do you feel your legs grow heavy as you enter that mist? That's the Deathlords. Their magic can put you into a deathly sleep if you are exposed to it for too long. So be quick killing them, won't you dear?
Don't worry, if you do get sent under, we'll always be right behind you ready to awaken you...
These Lieutenants believe they still rule armies, unaware that their orders are barked to no one but themselves. Ha! Show them their place, will you sweet?
Their words hold no power now. Show them.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_MORGANA_UNDEAD_GENER: The magic-wielding dead are tiresome - not strong enough to expend energy on; not weak enough to ignore. Deal with them, and prove that you have some character.
Don't return to me until you've finished the work.
How can skeletons loose arrows this fast? Break their bows, and break their bones.
Those husks clad in iron. The Undead call them soldiers, but they are not what they once were. They are merely relics of forgotten wars. Remind them of that.
These husks are hollow, their victories forgotten. They are to be shown no mercy.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_HERETIC_GE: Heretic thieves are rushing in to stab us in the backs, while their archers pick us off from afar. We need to break through them if we want to move ahead. And we do want that.
Have you made it through this damn wall of Heretics yet? You've been given a lot of responsibility now; we're trusting you with this.
We want to make sure that, when the Heretic leaders go down, they stay down. Make sure their healers don't interfere with our plans.
We're not sure if they can actually resurrect people, but we don't want to find out the hard way.
We suspect that the higher-ranking Heretic mages are acting as advisers to their leadership. Taking some of them out of the picture might make bringing the whole organization down much easier.
They surely cannot survive much more of this.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_KEEPER_BOS: The lower ranks have reported a huge woman walking around throwing axes at anything that moves. We'd hoped that they were just making her up, but my Lieutenant saw her this morning. Fancy like dealing with her for us, too? Confirmed: she is darned frightening!
Poor lad will need a pair of new breeches after that little encounter.
One of those Chieftain blokes went on a rampage after we slaughtered his tribe. Yes, it's understandable, but yes, we want him eliminated. Just... Put him out of his misery will you?
It's not like we can even spare their women... They'd put an axe in your head just as quick!
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_KEEPER_GEN: This is the very edge of our influence in Albion, and I'm fed up with pulling axes out of the outer walls every morning. It's time to stop being defensive, and strike out into the continent!
It'd be better for them if they'd just leave us alone.
We believe the druids are directing Keeper attacks. You'll need to deal with their berserkers to get to them, though.
If they're so smart, why do they keep getting in our way?
We've tried everything else - how about you just go and kill as many Keepers as you can find, and see if that convinces them to back off.
I find this sort of order distasteful, personally, but they're forcing our hand.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_UNDEAD_BOS: Captain wants this archer dealt with; apparently they've had one causing problems in the lower ranks... Seems they're now coordinating their attacks to distract us for some kind of plan. Make sure we don't find out what that plan is, right?
We don't want to wait long enough to find out what they've got planned for us... Best kill the damn archer first.

The Undead Deathlords are apparently causing some er... mess in the lower ranks. Well, they've now turned to us, too, and though we're no cowards, I'm struggling to keep my troops in line when they enter that mist. Go and get rid of them for us, too.
We can't afford to mess these beautiful trousers - they cost far too much!
The Undead Lieutenants are angry, lost. I'm thinking they need a bit of guidance to work out where they're going. Lead them back to their graves, will you?
Have you taken them to their final destination? Make sure they stay down there, this time.
@MISSIONS_T5_COMBAT_ROYALARMY_UNDEAD_GEN: This Undead menace needs to be halted in its tracks. Destroy their front-line fighters so we can do some real damage.
The uprising of Undead is getting out of hand. You'll need to deal with their archers if you're going to have any luck pushing them back.
I wonder where they're getting all their arrows?
The Undead could be a serious threat to our presence here, and their mages are the biggest headache. Please, go and thin their numbers a little!
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_1:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Please send more bows. Lots more bows.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_2:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Seeing more close-quarter action than anticipated. Many dead. Improvements needed.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_HUNTER_3:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Wear and tear/damage from enemy troops/lost due to dead soldiers.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_1_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Not enough damage output yet.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_1_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_2_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Support staffs are useful for keeping our support staff alive.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_2_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_3_O:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

If we're going to go to battle wearing cloth armor, I would like it to be *good* cloth armor at least.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_MAGE_3_P: Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_1_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Replacing dead couriers.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_2_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Need better capabilities for sourcing repair materials on-site.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_TOOLS_3_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Requisitioning tools which can double as weapons as needed.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_CRAFT_ROYALARTISAN_WARRIOR_:
The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Replacements for weapons broken due to excessive, enthusiastic killing of enemies.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.

The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

Replacement for weapons lost through general troop attrition.
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.

The King has authorized a subsidy in Silver for any individual who crafts the items listed in the attached work order, for the reason:

New armor to replace old armor now full of holes in all the wrong places'
Please report to your assigned Artisanal contact when the work is completed.
@MISSIONS_T5_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_BUILDIN: Got an order in for a big stack of high-quality wood and stone, for building defenses and the like. From what I hear from the front, they're going to need plenty of it soon enough. Can you get out there and collect some for me?
The resources you're pulling in today might be saving someone's life tomorrow.
@MISSIONS_T5_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_HUNTER_: Seems that the Sixth got hit by an awful rainstorm holding their hill the other night, and that much mud and rain plays hell with bows and leathers. Need to get new gear made up, so you gotta pull me in some hide and wood quick-like, alright?
Don't normally want to be fielding archers in those sorts of conditions, but war ain't always normal.
@MISSIONS_T5_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_MAGE_1_: Rumour is the last attack didn't have enough magical support, and it cost our troops pretty heavily. I'm anticipating a rush order for Mages' gear soon, and I'd like to get ahead of the curve on this one. Can you pull in the resources I need?
If they'd had a few more healers out there, they might've lost a lot fewer troops...
@MISSIONS_T5_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_TOOLS_1: You're a veteran at this by now, right? So I say "more tools needed", and you're already up and off collecting the wood and ore we need. Right? The circle... yes...
You know the drill - I don't need to give you any more instructions.
@MISSIONS_T5_GATHER_ROYALFORAGER_WARRIOR: Just got word, the last big attack was a failure. Lotta dead people, and a lotta busted-up armour and weapons. They need ore, hide and fiber for replacement equipment ASAP, or they're going to be fighting off the counter-attack with sticks and stones.
Luckily the field smiths are pretty good at patching up plate by now. King knows they've had plenty of practice...
@MISSIONS_T5_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_HEAV: Big shipment of medical supplies for the front. We need to make sure our medics are seriously stocked up before we start the next push, because they're going to need it.
Let's just hope our casualties come back in few enough pieces that they need healers rather than gravediggers.

You be careful with these - very careful. The compounds in these barrels are very unstable. If there's a spark anywhere near you as you're carrying them, you and your fine mount will spontaneously combust. Yes, that means fire. No, it's not good.
Please keep a safe distance from... well, anyone and everyone.

This is a load of old scrap metal we've found digging around the ruins in the centre of the continent. Should be bashed into makeshift shields and helms for the poorer troops if they can't craft one themselves.
We're hoping we haven't picked up any of that antique gold our historians were looking at...
@MISSIONS_T5_TRANSPORT_ROYALSTEWARD_LIGH: You're a trusted ally at this point, so I'll be straight with you: here is a package of assassination orders, please take them to my colleague so he can distribute them to our agents. If we can eliminate certain enemy leaders, it'll save a lot of lives.
Yes, there are a lot of them. I know.
Casualty reports from our front-line patrols, for delivery. It's important for the King and his advisors to have a good idea of what's happening, and keeping track of troop losses is part of that.
Yes, there are a lot of them. I know.

Identification rings for regimental leaders. Sometimes when the big white guys with the maces get hold of one... there's no other way of us knowing who they were so we can tell their family. Make sure these get delivered and worn, yes?
Being able to tell their families is the least we owe them.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_HERETIC_BOSS_: A dark thing lurks in the shadows; silent footsteps, a heavy cloak, eyes alight with madness and the glimmer of gold. Destroy it, that we might make more offerings to Mother.
Mother gives so much, and asks so little. We must give her the offerings.
The Arsonists work indiscriminately, setting light to the dry grasses and burning entire forests to the ground. We cannot bear it, it burns us too! Please help us protect the wild from their flames!
Break their bodies as they break our hearts!
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_HERETIC_GENER: Heretic mages disrupt the flows of the land. Dispose of them and their kin.
My brethren suffer from stab-wounds and stolen fetishes. Find those responsible and break them.
We tire of the Heretics' poor arrows. They do dishonour to the wood that made them! Break their quivers, and their necks too.
What shame, to be killed by such poor craftsmanship!
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_MORGANA_BOSS_: The priestesses of Morgana are channels for her power, tainting the earth with her touch once more. They tether her to this world - the tie must be broken!
She is diminished, but never dead. We must remove anything that could light her path back to this world!
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_MORGANA_GENER: The Disciples of Morgana return to Albion. Their helms burn bright with cunning. End them, now.
There can be no mercy here, friend.
They take life from the land, but nothing more. They dishonour the spirits of those they kill. Repay the debt.
To kill the creatures of the land is permitted, provided you bring them new purpose.
The cultists spread Her lies. Reach them and silence them; She is capable of corrupting even the strongest minds.
The weak must not hear Her words!
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_PROMOTION_1_O: You have served Albion well, friend. Take this token to [variable:AGENT_A], that you may serve further.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_PROMOTION_1_P: Service does the land honour, friend.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_BOSS_1: An Infiltrator entered our yearly ritual of the equinox, and picked off the weak as they danced and made music... The children, the old, the sick praying to be healed... This is an abomination. Kill any you see. And make them suffer.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_BOSS_2: The archmages, reawakened, still seek to push the boundaries of magic. We grow wary of their foul experiments. Ensure they are... made safe.
They play with powers beyond their control. They cannot be allowed to continue.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_BOSS_3: These are the Voyagers, the bold adventures sent out against the forces of Morgana at the height of the war. None of them ever returned. Their will to follow their masters, for victory in battle, still remains. They were so young... Put their hearts to rest.
They have done more than their duty.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_GENERI: Why do they walk the land once more? We can hope that destroying their physical form will allow them to rest again.
It is a sad duty, but a necessary one.
They loose their arrows with the same courage, the same strength... but now no purpose. Give them peace.
They do not understand this new world.
What secrets might their mages carry with them? But we owe them their peace, they have suffered enough.
One death is more than enough for any soul.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_HERETIC_BOSS: This sneak thief sends in his underlings to goad our steel away, then takes what he wishes from our abandoned camps. The Heretics are far too puny to bear our weapons; what do they want with them?
We fear they may be melting down our weapons to arm their legions...

14 Cheat Protection
The Publisher uses the Kamu Game Security service ("Easy Anti-Cheat") and the Wellbia Co. Ltd. service ("Xigncode"), which are operated by third-party service providers offering services to the Publisher. 
Easy Anti-Cheat and Xigncode have a client software ("Client") that is integrated into the Software Product. When you start a new Game session the Client will automatically load and install its latest version to the Unit. When you are using the Software Product on your Unit, Easy Anti-Cheat and Xigncode monitor the Unit, analyzing the Game binaries and scanning the memory of the Unit for the purpose of detecting and preventing cheating in the Game ("Purpose"). For this Purpose, Easy Anti-Cheat and Xigncode will store information regarding cheating methods used in the Game ("Data"). The Data will contain your personal data as described in the privacy statement of Easy Anti-Cheat and the end user license agreement of Xigncode. By installing, copying, or otherwise using this Software Product, you give your consent that Easy Anti-Cheat and Xigncode may gather, store, share and publish Data solely in regards to this Purpose. You also acknowledge and agree that the processing activities of Easy Anti-Cheat and Xigncode include automated decision-making which may have significant effects for you as you may be banned from the game if you have been found to be cheating in it. The Data will be used solely for the Purpose, including (but not limited to): identifying and banning player accounts which are used for cheating in computer games, analyzing cheating behavior and cheating codes, and sharing data about cheats with affiliates of Easy Anti-Cheat and Xigncode respectively. You are entitled to use the Game (i.e. Software Product) only in accordance with these terms and conditions and privacy statements of Easy Anti-Cheat and Xigncode.
You will find more information about the privacy practices of Easy Anti-Cheat on the company's own privacy statement, which you can find at https://www.easy.ac/support/albion/account/privacy/. 
You will find more information about Xigncode on the company's own end user license agreement, which you can find at https://wellbia.com/?module=Html&action=SiteComp&sSubNo=5 
If you deny Easy Anti-Cheat or Xigncode the ability to process your personal data in accordance with the said privacy statement or end user license agreement or request that Easy Anti-Cheat or Xigncode remove or delete your personal data, the Publisher, Easy Anti-Cheat, Xigncode, or a third party (appointed by the Publisher,Easy Anti-Cheat or Xigncode) have the right to block your access to the Game and prevent your use of the Game.

Further claims of the User are excluded unless otherwise specified in these Terms and Conditions.

Notwithstanding any statutory or other contractual rights Sandbox Interactive can temporarily or permanently restrict or disable access to the Game or the Services for any Users who are at fault for being in continued, repeated or severe breach of statutes, third party rights, Game Rules or these Terms and Conditions. Sandbox Interactive may temporarily or permanently bar Users according to legal regulations. For example, Sandbox Interactive may restrict the chat functionality or suspend a User from the forum if this User offends other Users in the forum or chat. As another example Users may be banned permanently if they use cheats or bots. The sanctions for the misconduct cited are only examples. Sanctions can vary based on the infraction in question.
