Effective February 13, 2023
Children should not be allowed to play with fire...
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_HERETIC_GENE: It's so much easier to create fear when you remove the safety nets, don't you think? Go out and kill some Heretic healers, that should make our other efforts much more effective.
Destroying one's enemies from the bottom up is... rather beautiful, don't you think?
The slight ones roam in the shadows; they know no honour in combat! Make sure they are facing you when you deal the final blow.
But to see the light leave their eyes...
The crazed ones like to fight from afar, with magic and arrows.Our cultists can only remove so many - bring the rats in close for once.
Their flesh is soft, their bones brittle.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_KEEPER_BOSS_: The heavy ones are made to drink the milk of some flower before they go into battle, and it drives away any fear or pain, allowing them to kill many before they are brought down.
The Disciples need no poisons; She gives us bravery and courage for battle.

A Giant's boulder struck one of our bravest champions days ago. Shattered her spine inside her armor, nothing we could do. I had to remove her helmet and slit her throat myself. I want you to promise me that I won't have to do that again.
If you do this... The Disciples will be in your debt, truly. And that means something.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_KEEPER_ELITE: The old ones are savage and ruthless. They grow crazed in battle, defending their precious land. Show them the refined manner of the Knight.
It's a chilling sight, no? Hoards of frothing, painted faces rushing into battle? Take heart, dear.
Where we employ brawn and steel to battle, the Keepers use stone straight from the earth. Show them the inferiority of their weapons.
The Druids have mastered the magical energies of Albion, but we have never yielded to them before, and will not start now.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_KEEPER_GENER: The old ones are savage and ruthless. They grow crazed in battle, defending their precious land. Show them the refined manner of the Knight.
It's a chilling sight, no? Hoards of frothing, painted faces rushing into battle? Take heart, dear.
Where we employ brawn and steel to battle, the Keepers use stone straight from the earth. Show them the inferiority of their weapons.
The Druids have mastered the magical energies of Albion, but we have never yielded to them before, and will not start now.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_PROMOTION_1_: You please the lady Morgana. Take this letter to [variable:AGENT_A] in the wastes, and take the fight to the heart of their foul crypts
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_UNDEAD_BOSS_: The chief archers have some ancient poison on their arrows. With all their strength and steel, how can our knights fight that which attacks their very blood?
We fear that whatever plant or berry bore the antidote died out many years ago - as the undead should have!
Only the Undead could wield the magic of doom so masterfully. It's said the bells in their ruined churches and crypts still hum with that obscene power. Silence them!
When their magic is quelled, perhaps the ringing will stop?
The Voyagers interfered the most with Morgana's plans; an endless sea of trained soldiers, still brought to their knees by a mere whisper from Her lips. And now they dare to meddle again?
Perhaps being buried once is not enough...
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_MORGANA_UNDEAD_GENER: Why do these soldiers of old appear animate now? Be a sweet and return them to their prior state, would you? What happened in the old wars should stay buried...
What happened in the old wars should stay buried...
The Undead work with some magical power now, and they wield it like experienced sorcerers. How far they have come since the wars...
Cut down the mages - they pose the biggest threat.
One would think the dead had learned the first time... No matter, some lessons demand a second teaching.
Maybe this time they will learn? One can but hope...
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_HERETIC_BOSS_: The thieves desecrate our crypts, stealing tokens and preparations from the tombs of our brothers and sisters. Now their souls will never make the journey they set out to on death, and will suffer for all eternity. Stop the thieves!
They do not know the damage they do!
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_HERETIC_GENER: The ones with the knives... always poking, always digging. What for? They bring us to the surface, and they break us when they find us. Punish them.
They show no clear purpose, they just destroy.
The hermits... Their magic burns us, eats us away inside where we have no inside. Drive them away from us.
How can it hurt so much? What is it they wield?
These... "Heretics". They destroy, they subvert, they create nothing of worth, all they bring is decay and dissolution... They should be excised, for the good of all.
The living... squander their existence. Why?
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_KEEPER_BOSS_1: The Berserks hammer us to pieces! Fragments scattered to the winds, a disgraceful burial! We are husks, yes, but may we not at least remain whole?
Destroy those who bring us disgrace!
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_KEEPER_BOSS_2: The giants! Their every step sends a shiver down through the earth! They crack the stones of our crypts and trap us in the dark. To be buried is a fate to suffer only once!
They won't be easy to bring down... They never have been.
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_KEEPER_ELITE_: The men here... always running, stamping, shouting... it shakes our bones, it jars our joints... does it wake us from our sleep? We wish to sleep... Stop them. Please.
Why must they break the earth with their stride?
The ones with the long beards... our mages sense their magic, say they work with powers of life. Is it them who bind us to this undeath? We wish to sleep... Make them stop.
If they do not understand, they should not meddle!
Drumming and dancing and running and chanting and stamping and stomping and crashing and thumping... Too much too much TOO MUCH MAKE THEM STOP... We only wish to sleep...
What corruption compels them to agitate the land so?
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_KEEPER_GENERI: The men here... always running, stamping, shouting... it shakes our bones, it jars our joints... does it wake us from our sleep? We wish to sleep... Stop them. Please.
Why must they break the earth with their stride?
The ones with the long beards... our mages sense their magic, say they work with powers of life. Is it them who bind us to this undeath? We wish to sleep... Make them stop.
If they do not understand, they should not meddle!
Drumming and dancing and running and chanting and stamping and stomping and crashing and thumping... Too much too much TOO MUCH MAKE THEM STOP... We only wish to sleep...
What corruption compels them to agitate the land so?
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_MORGANA_BOSS_: They call them Priestesses... But there was nothing so unholy and dishonourable! It was they who buried our brothers and sisters in unmarked graves; trapped their souls beyond retrieval. I want them to feel that fear.
See how they feel to be denied a final audience with their abhorrent Queen!
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_MORGANA_GENER: The ones in robes... they stand behind and keep control. Mayhap they know something of our prior fate?
Did you find what was inside them?
We... remember a hail of bolts, falling out of the sky. Ours? Or theirs? Collect some for us, perhaps they will stir memory.
The hum of the string, it calls to us... a warning?
We watch them fight, and something stirs. Were... were we soldiers? Is this a shard of memory? Or did we merely watch?
It is so hard to be sure, the past is like a broken mirror. Are we broken?
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_PROMOTION_1_O: You bring us the rest we crave... We thank you... [variable:AGENT_A] also seeks your help - will you go to their aid?
@MISSIONS_T6_COMBAT_UNDEAD_PROMOTION_1_P: You bring quiet... This is good...
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_KEEPER_MORGANA_BOSS_: The Icons are made in Her image, abhorrent reminders of what once was. They are Her most powerful magic-wielders, and their very existence threatens Albion. Remove this threat!
Be careful, the Icons wield powerful dark magic.
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_KEEPER_MORGANA_GENER: These armored knights... we know that strange glow behind that metal. Why do they return now?
The armour - we must know all you can tell of their armour!
The cultists move to some hidden purpose, some silent beating drum... and a tang in the deepest earths... brimstone? This bodes evil.
To what foul purpose do they bend their will?
At every turn, blades and bolts block our search. Clear the way, so that our wisest might hope to understand...
It pains us to beg assistance in this, but their strength!
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_KEEPER_PROMOTION_1_O: You have served Albion well, friend. Take this token to [variable:AGENT_A], that you may serve further.
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_KEEPER_PROMOTION_1_P: Service does the land honour, friend.
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_KEEPER_UNDEAD_GENERI: It brings us little pleasure, but the Undead must be stopped before the damage they do threatens our lands. Do what must be done.
Be gentle if you can, but you must return them to their rest.
Why do those who fought and died wish to fight again? And why do those who stood with the land now struggle against it?
There is a higher power at work here.
The cycle of life and death is central to this land... but these Undead subvert its workings. They are an aberration that must be corrected.
Close the circle, for their own good as well as for ours.
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_MORGANA_UNDEAD_GENER: The Undead reign in the Deadlands, plaguing the skies with their foul mists; our champions cannot fight cloaked enemies. Perhaps you can?
As much as we love the dark, this world cannot be left to fester in their mists.
We need to make our way into the crypts of the Undead far below the earth. Never you mind why. We need the space... clean.
We need a large, clear space for our work.
The armies, risen again, are as strong as ever. But they were overpowered once; and must be again.
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_UNDEAD_MORGANA_BOSS_: We know those horns, the brutal, glowing heart of that staff, the cruelty in those eyes. A High Priestess, sent to do Her bidding. She must not be allowed to continue!
Don't get too close! And remember: You must never listen to a word she utters!
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_UNDEAD_MORGANA_GENER: The Knights... we remember their blades... We remember them scything us down like wheat... So much power... More than a man should ever contain. Kill them as they killed us.
We do not feel pity... Because they do not deserve it, or because we no longer can?

Their soldiers... We gave as good as we got. It was a fair fight, us against them... But then they brought... OTHER things to bear. The Soldiers gloated as they ran us through, once the balance was tipped in their favor. Show them how it feels.
They had our respect... At first...
Their bolts fell into us, like a piercing arch. Our arrows flew in return, but without the dark weight that rained down on our heads. They were... unnatural.
They pierced through us, and they pierced through the stones around us.
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_UNDEAD_PROMOTION_1_O: They seek to recover their former strength, but they have not attained it yet. We must strike now, before they do. Go, help [variable:AGENT_A] make the final push!
@MISSIONS_T7_COMBAT_UNDEAD_PROMOTION_1_P: This time, we will have our revenge.
@MISSIONS_T8_COMBAT_KEEPER_MORGANA_ELITE: Demons. The Cultists consort with demons. Kill them. All. NOW!
We fear for the very land itself, if their plans come to pass...
Do the Disciples have a new puppeteer now? Or are they caught in a pact? No matter - they must be held to account.
They will be held accountable for their experiments with dark forces, as they were before.
They are all equally culpable in the atrocity they strive towards. End them as the monsters they are.
How could any living person countenance such an offence against life itself?
@MISSIONS_T8_COMBAT_UNDEAD_MORGANA_ELITE: The Cultists, they brought the darkness before. We will not allow them to do so again. Find them. Kill them. Break the cycle.
They know what they do, and they will not repent. They must be brought to justice.
Their infantry, they fight on the side of darkness. We must stand in the light, and let them know they cannot succeed a second time. Strike them down.
We remember. We do not hate. But we finally understand. We know what must be done.

Last we fought, they broke us 'cross their knee. Now they find that without their dark power they are weak, and yet without our flesh we still stand strong. Let them taste the bitter realization that we last knew when we saw the battle's looming end.
This is no longer our time, but this is finally our turn.
@MISSIONS_TRADE_PACK_CAERLEON_TO_FACTION:
You didn't die, [playername]. Better than the poor sap I sent last time. You might just make it in [agentplayerfaction] after all.

Next round of ale is on me.

[playername], you wanna make some coin? Take this [variable:ITEM_REQUIRED] to our contact near [variable:FACTION_B]. We'll trade it for some [variable:ITEM_REWARD], and then sell it for a fortune to the traders around [agentplayerfaction]. 

So you in or should I find somebody better?

Ha. I thought I could count on you, [playername]. Now take this [variable:ITEM_A] to [variable:AGENTS_A].

They're well connected in [variable:FACTION_B], and they'll be expecting you.

Now get out of here before I change my mind, [playername]!
@MISSIONS_TRADE_PACK_TO_OUTPOST_FAILCOND: KEEP the quest item in your inventory!
Don't get killed or knocked down.
@MISSIONS_TRADE_PACK_TO_OUTPOST_REQUIREM:
Stay below 100% weight
({0} after accepting quest)
@MISSIONS_TRADE_PACK_TO_OUTPOST_STEP2: Return to {0} in {1} with the payload.

@MOBSPEAK_CASTLE_LORD: This is MY castle. Get out!
@MOBSPEAK_CITYGUARD_SILVERCOURIER: You've ruined your own lands, you'll not ruin mine!
@MOBSPEAK_HARVESTER_PLAYERSPAWN_ENRAGE_B: Even more little souls... your lifeforce calls to me....
All this lifeforce around me.... I SHALL BECOME DEATH.
@MOBSPEAK_HERETIC_MAGE: I will kill you... with fire... hehe!
@MOBSPEAK_KEEPER_DRUID: Your existence threatens the balance... you must die...
@MOBSPEAK_KEEPER_EARTHMOTHER: Come to me! I'll give your flesh to the birds of the sky and to the beasts of the field
@MOBSPEAK_KEEPER_EARTHMOTHER_PHASE_2: You thought this would be easy?
@MOBSPEAK_KEEPER_EARTHMOTHER_PHASE_3: We are not done anytime soon!
@MOBSPEAK_KEEPER_SEER: In life you torture Albion. In death you feed it!
@MOBSPEAK_MORGANA_CHAMPION: You got this far... but you will go no further!
@MOBSPEAK_MORGANA_CHAMPION_ENRAGE_BUFF_1: What? So many of you? No matter.
@MOBSPEAK_MORGANA_CHAMPION_ENRAGE_BUFF_2: Your numbers are meaningless, I will fight even harder!
@MOBSPEAK_MORGANA_CHAMPION_ENRAGE_BUFF_3: Arrrr! Fighting so many awakens the power of Morgana in me!

Portal Towns have everything you need, from Artifact Foundries to Expedition Masters
Portal Towns share the Marketplace and Bank of their Royal City
There are two invisibility shrines at each exit
@PORTAL_CITY_INFO_TEXT_02:
The shrine grants every adventurer who uses it 120s of invisibility and immunity
While invisible, you can neither attack nor use any abilities 
Interacting with the world, like gathering or looting, will break the invisibility and leave you silenced

Greetings, Adventurer!
 
In anticipation of the upcoming GvG Season 4, we're giving all players with a valid game pack 7 free days of Premium status.
 
You can claim your reward by selecting "Claim Rewards" in the Settings menu (the cogwheel symbol at the top right corner of your screen).
 
-Your Albion Online Team

Greetings, Adventurer!
 
To celebrate the launch of Albion Online's Lancelot update, all players with a Founder or Starter Pack will receive 7 free days of Premium status.
 
You can claim your reward by selecting "Claim Rewards" in the Settings menu (the cogwheel symbol at the top right corner of your screen).
 
-Your Albion Online Team
@PREMIUM_MERLYN_MAIL_TEXT:
Greetings, Adventurer!
 
To celebrate the launch of Albion Online's Merlyn update, we've sent all players 5 free days of Premium status.

-Your Albion Online Team

@SPELLS_PBAOE_KNOCKBACK_DESC:
Send out a shockwave, [cc]knocking back[/cc] all enemies within a [other]$applyspell[0].effectarearadius$ radius[/other] around you by [cc]$$PBAOE_KNOCKBACK_KNOCKBACK.knockback[0].distance$[/cc] (ignoring Crowd Control Resistance).
Deals [dmg]$directattributechange[0].change$ magical damage[/dmg].
@SPELLS_PBAOE_PULL_DESC:
Create a vacuum in a [other]$pull[0].effectarearadius$ radius[/other] around you, [cc]pulling[/cc] all enemies towards you.
Increases your [other]threat[/other] towards all mobs hit by [other]$changeaggro.value$[/other].
@SPELLS_PERPETUALENERGY_DESC: Tap into the wild energies around you, reducing your [buff]Energy Costs[/buff] to [buff]0[/buff] for [buff]$buffovertime[0].time$[/buff].
@SPELLS_POISONARROW_DESC:
Attack the targeted enemy, dealing [dmg]$directattributechange[0].change$ physical damage[/dmg].
Poisons the targeted enemy, dealing [dmg]$attributechangeovertime[0].totalchange$ magic damage[/dmg] over [dmg]$attributechangeovertime[0].totalduration$[/dmg] ([other]stacks[/other] up to [other]$maxcharges$[/other] times).
@SPELLS_PORTAL_RESTRICTION_BINDING_DESC: You can only travel to the last used portal exit
@SPELLS_PORTAL_RESTRICTION_BINDING_IMMUN: Returning while this buff is active will remove the binding to the last-used portal.
@SPELLS_PORTAL_RESTRICTION_BINDING_INVIS: Invisible for $invisibility[0].time, and cannot attack while this is active.
@SPELLS_PORTAL_RESTRICTION_BRIDGEWATCH_D:
You can only use the city portal in Bridgewatch.

To remove this binding you need to travel to a different-colored portal in the Outlands.

To remove this binding you need to travel to a different-colored portal in the Outlands.

Attack the targeted enemy, dealing [dmg]$directattributechange[0].change$ physical damage[/dmg].
Applies [other]one Sunder Armor Charge[/other].

Each [other]Sunder Armor Charge[/other] decreases [debuff]damage resistances[/debuff] by [debuff]$buffovertime[0].value$[/debuff] (vs players) / [debuff]$buffovertime[2].value$[/debuff] (vs mobs) for [debuff]$buffovertime[0].time$[/debuff] ([other]stacks[/other] up to [other]$maxcharges$[/other] times).
@SPELLS_SUNDERSHOT_DESC:
Release a well-aimed bolt at the targeted enemy, dealing [dmg]$directattributechange[0].change$ physical damage[/dmg].
Decreases [debuff]damage resistances[/debuff] by [debuff]$$SUNDERSHOT_DEBUFF.buffovertime[0].value$[/debuff] for every [other]$applyspell[9].IfTargetHealthPercentage[0].value$ Health[/other] the targeted enemy has left ([other]stacks[/other] up to [other]$$SUNDERSHOT_DEBUFF.maxcharges$[/other] times) for [debuff]$$SUNDERSHOT_DEBUFF.buffovertime[0].time$[/debuff].
@SPELLS_SWAP_DESC:
[mobility]Teleport[/mobility] to the target, swapping positions with them (can't teleport through obstacles).
[cc]Interrupts[/cc] the target's spell casting.
Grants [buff]immunity[/buff] to [buff]damage[/buff] for [buff]$invincibility[0].time$[/buff].
@SPELLS_SWORD_SPIN_DESC:

If at least one [other]Heroic Charge[/other] is active on you, the ability will consume one charge, dealing [dmg]$$SWORD_SPIN_DAMAGE.directattributechange[0].change$ physical damage[/dmg] each time instead.

@SPELLS_VAULT_ATTACK_DESC:
[mobility]Vault Leap[/mobility] to the targeted position, dealing [dmg]$$VAULT_ATTACK_EFFECT.directattributechange[0].change$ physical damage[/dmg] in a [other]$nop[0].effectarearadius$ radius[/other] (can't be interrupted).
[cc]Throws[/cc] all enemies hit [cc]into the air[/cc] for [cc]$$VAULT_ATTACK_KNOCKBACK.knockback[0].duration$[/cc].
@SPELLS_VOID_TEST_DESC:
Summon an entropic bubble with a [other]{0} radius[/other], growing up to [other]{1}[/other], while [other]channeling[/other] for [other]{2}[/other] (can't be interrupted).
[other]Cleanses[/other] all [other]debuffs[/other] (except damage over time effects) and [other]Crowd Control effects[/other] of [other]all allies[/other] within the bubble.
Increases [buff]damage resistances[/buff] by [buff]{3}[/buff].
@SPELLS_VOID_V2_DESC:
Summon an entropic bubble with a [other]{0} radius[/other], growing up to [other]{1}[/other], while [other]channeling[/other] for [other]{2}[/other] (can't be interrupted).
[other]Cleanses[/other] all [other]debuffs[/other] (except damage over time effects) and [other]Crowd Control effects[/other] of [other]all allies[/other] within the bubble.
Grants [buff]immunity[/buff] to [buff]Crowd Control effects[/buff] and [buff]debuffs[/buff].
Increases [buff]damage resistances[/buff] by [buff]{3}[/buff].
@SPELLS_WANDERLUST_DESC:
Fill yourself with Wanderlust, increasing your [buff]Move Speed[/buff] by [buff]$$WANDERLUST_EFFECT.buffovertime[0].value$[/buff] every [buff]$pulsingspell[0].interval$[/buff] ([other]stacks[/other] up to [other]$$WANDERLUST_EFFECT.maxcharges$[/other] times).
Lasts for [buff]$$WANDERLUST_EFFECT.buffovertime[0].time$[/buff] after max stacks are reached.
@SPELLS_WARCAMP_INVULNERABILITY_DESC: Protects you from damage and heals you
@SPELLS_WATERSHIELD_BUFF_DESC:
[buff]Damage resistances[/buff] increased by [buff]$buffovertime[0].value$[/buff].
[buff]Fishing Speed[/buff] increased by [buff]$buffovertime[2].value$[/buff].
@SPELLS_WATERSHIELD_DESC: Surround yourself with a whirlpool, increasing your [buff]Armor[/buff] by [buff]$buffovertime[0].value$[/buff], your [buff]Magic Resistance[/buff] by [buff]$buffovertime[1].value$[/buff], and your [buff]Fishing Speed[/buff] by [buff]$buffovertime[2].value$[/buff] for [buff]$buffovertime[0].time$[/buff].
@SPELLS_WEAPON_DOT_BUFF_DESC: Your next [other]normal attack[/other] poisons the target, dealing [dmg]$$WEAPON_DOT_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].totalchange$ magical damage[/dmg] over [dmg]$$WEAPON_DOT_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].time$[/dmg].
@SPELLS_WEAPON_DOT_DESC:
Coat your weapon with poison for [other]$applyeffectoneventactive[0].time$[/other], poisoning the next target of your first normal attack.
Deals [dmg]$$WEAPON_DOT_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].totalchange$ magical damage[/dmg] over [dmg]$$WEAPON_DOT_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].totalduration$[/dmg].
@SPELLS_WEAPON_SILENCE_DESC: Enchant your weapon, [cc]silencing[/cc] the targeted enemy for [cc]$$WEAPON_SILENCE_EFFECT.silence[0].time$[/cc] with your next [other]normal attack[/other] within the next [other]$applyeffectoneventactive[0].time$[/other].
@SPELLS_WELLOFLIFE2_DESC:
Create a Well of Life with a [other]$spelleffectarea[0].circle[0].radius_start$ radius[/other] at the targeted position, lasting [other]$spelleffectarea[0].time$[/other].
Heals up to [other]$spelleffectarea[0].maxeffectareatargets$[/other] allies within the Well for [heal]$$WELLOFLIFE2_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].change$ Health[/heal] every [heal]$$WELLOFLIFE2_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].interval$[/heal].
@SPELLS_WHIRLING_STAFF_DESC:
Whirl your staff around, dealing [dmg]$$WHIRLING_STAFF_DAMAGE.directattributechange[0].change physical damage[/dmg] every [dmg]$channeling[0].effectinterval$[/dmg] in a [other]$channeling[0].applyspell[0].effectarearadius$ radius[/other] while [other]channeling[/other] for up to [other]$channeling[0].totalduration$[/other] (can move while channeling).

Hitting at least [other]one enemy[/other] will [buff]reduce[/buff] this ability's [buff]cooldown[/buff] by [buff]$$WHIRLING_STAFF_EFFECT.resetcooldowns[0].amount$[/buff] for [buff]$$WHIRLING_STAFF_STACK.dummy[0].time$[/buff] ([other]stacks[/other] up to [other]$$WHIRLING_STAFF_STACK.maxcharges$[/other] times).
@SPELLS_WILD_MAGIC_DESC:
Rotate every [other]$pulsingspell.interval$[/other] through [other]3 different magical effects[/other]. Recasting the ability selects the effect.

1st [other]Ring of Fire:[/other]
Create a Ring of Fire with a [other]$$WILD_MAGIC_FIRE.spelleffectarea[0].arc[0].innerradius_start$ radius[/other] on the ground around you, lasting [other]$$WILD_MAGIC_FIRE.spelleffectarea[0].time$[/other]. Sets all enemies touching it aflame, dealing [dmg]$$WILD_MAGIC_FIRE_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].totalchange$ magical damage[/dmg] over [dmg]$$WILD_MAGIC_FIRE_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].time$[/dmg]. Burning enemies will [cc]flee[/cc] from you for [cc]$$WILD_MAGIC_FIRE_FEAR.forcedmovement[0].time$[/cc] (mobs flee only once).

2nd [other]Storm Shield:[/other]
Increases your [buff]damage resistances[/buff] by [buff]$$WILD_MAGIC_LIGHTNING.buffovertime[0].value$[/buff] for [buff]$$WILD_MAGIC_LIGHTNING.buffovertime[0].time$[/buff]. Whenever you take direct damage, shock the attacker if within [other]$$WILD_MAGIC_LIGHTNING.aura[0].auraradius$[/other] of you, dealing [dmg]$$WILD_MAGIC_LIGHTNING_EFFECT.attributechangeovertime[0].change$ magical damage[/dmg]. [cc]Stuns[/cc] for [cc]$$WILD_MAGIC_LIGHTNING_EFFECT.stun[0].time[/cc].

3rd [other]Frozen Fragments:[/other]
Summon [other]$$WILD_MAGIC_ICE.applyeffectoneventactive[0].count$[/other] Fragments for [other]$$WILD_MAGIC_ICE.applyeffectoneventactive[0].time$[/other]. Whenever you deal direct damage, consumes a Fragment and deals [dmg]$$WILD_MAGIC_ICE_DAMAGE.attributechangeovertime[0].change$ magical damage[/dmg]. Decreases [debuff]max[/debuff] and [debuff]current Health[/debuff] by [debuff]$$WILD_MAGIC_ICE_DEBUFF.buffovertime[0].value$[/debuff] for [debuff]$$WILD_MAGIC_ICE_DEBUFF.buffovertime[0].time$[/debuff] ([other]stacks[/other] up to [other]$$WILD_MAGIC_ICE_DEBUFF.maxcharges$[/other] times).
@SPELLS_WILD_MAGIC_ROTATION_LOCK_DESC: Activate to conjure currently selected Wild Magic effect.

@SPELLS_WINDSHIELD_BUFF_DESC:
[buff]Damage resistances[/buff] increased by [buff]$buffovertime[0].value$[/buff].
[buff]Gathering Speed[/buff] increased by [buff]$buffovertime[2].value$[/buff].

Whenever you take damage, [cc]knock back[/cc] all enemies within a [other]$$WINDSHIELD_EFFECT.knockback[0].effectarearadius$ radius[/other] by [cc]$$WINDSHIELD_EFFECT.knockback[0].distance$[/cc].
@SPELLS_WINDSHIELD_DESC:
Surround yourself in twisting winds, increasing your [buff]damage resistances[/buff] by [buff]$buffovertime[0].value$[/buff] and your [buff]Gathering Speed[/buff] by [buff]$buffovertime[2].value$[/buff] for [buff]$buffovertime[0].time$[/buff].

Whenever you take damage, release a gust of wind in a [other]$$WINDSHIELD_EFFECT.knockback[0].effectarearadius$ radius[/other] around you, [cc]knocking back[/cc] all enemies hit by [cc]$$WINDSHIELD_EFFECT.knockback[0].distance$[/cc].

@TOWN_PORTAL_OVERHEAD_ERROR_LOST_ACCESS_: You no longer have access to the target Hideout.
@TOWN_PORTAL_OVERHEAD_ERROR_ZERG: There are too many people close by.

@TREASURE_CHEST_DOES_NOT_OWN_CASTLEOUTPO: You need to be in the guild that owns the Castle Outpost to open this treasure chest.
@TREASURE_CHEST_INFO: A new treasure will appear in {0}
@TREASURE_CHEST_WOLRD_INFO: The next treasure will be revealed in: {0}
@TREASURE_DESTINATION_CRYSTAL_DESCRIPTIO: Escort your wisp to safety here!
@TREASURE_EVENT_ANNIVERSARY_STATUE_DESC: A strong enemy that will require a group to defeat.
@TREASURE_HARVESTABLE_FIBER_DESC: A plant with plenty of Tier {0}.{1} fiber
@TREASURE_HARVESTABLE_HIDE_DESC: A specimen with plenty of Tier {0}.{1} hide
@TREASURE_HARVESTABLE_ORE_DESC: A vein with plenty of Tier {0}.{1} ore
@TREASURE_HARVESTABLE_ROCK_DESC: A boulder with plenty of Tier {0}.{1} stone
@TREASURE_HARVESTABLE_WOOD_DESC: A tree with plenty of Tier {0}.{1} wood
@TREASURE_POWERCRYSTAL_HIDEOUT_DESC: This Core's magical shielding will fade in {0}
@TRIAL_REFUND_TEXT:
Congratulations! 

One of your referred friends has qualified you for rewards.

Thank you for your support!

Your Albion Online Team
@TRUSTED_REACHEDLIMIT_GOLD:
A maximum of {1} Gold per day can be traded for Silver.
Would you like to request that this limit be permanently raised for your account? (Requests are usually processed within 24 hours.)
For further information, please visit albiononline.com/gold-limits.
@TRUSTED_REQUEST_APPROVED_MAIL_TEXT:
We're happy to inform you that your account is now flagged as trusted and all restrictions are hereby lifted. 
For details, please visit www.albiononline.com/gold-limits
 
We wish you all the best in Albion Online.
- Your Sandbox Interactive Team
@TRUSTED_REQUEST_RESENT: You already have a pending request to verify your account. This process is usually completed within 24 hours. For further information, please visit albiononline.com/gold-limits.
@TRUSTED_REQUEST_SENT: Thank you! Our support team will verify your account as soon as possible. This process is usually completed within 24 hours. For further information, please visit albiononline.com/gold-limits.
@TUTORIAL_ADC_DAILY_BONUS_TEXT: Collect the daily required points to gain additional [icon:CHALLENGEPOINTS] Challenge Points and [icon:LEARNINGPOINTS] Learning Points
@TUTORIAL_ADC_POINTS_TEXT:
You earn [icon:CHALLENGEPOINTS] from PvE, gathering, fishing and farming.
You need [icon:PREMIUM] Premium in order to earn [icon:CHALLENGEPOINTS].
@TUTORIAL_APPEARANCE_SKINS_UNLOCKS_TEXT:
All skins purchased with real money via the ingame store or the Web Shop are unlocked globally across all servers.
Skins earned through ingame activities, referrals, or purchased with Gold unlock only on the current server.
@TUTORIAL_APPEARANCE_SKINS_WHAT_TEXT:
Unlock vanity skins via ingame loot, the Albion Store, Twitch Drops and more to give your character a unique look in the Wardrobe section.
Customize the looks of your mount in the Mount Skins section.
Equip a skin by dragging and dropping it into the corresponding skin slot.
@TUTORIAL_ARENA_RULES_TEXT:
Each team starts with 150 points.
The Match is won by reducing the opponent's points to zero.
Reduce your opponent's points by capturing Runestones (-10 Points) or killing enemy players (-2 Points per killed player).
Capture Runestones by having at least one friendly player and no opponents within the capture zone.
@TUTORIAL_ARENA_SIGN_UP_TEXT:
The Arena allows you to fight unranked 5v5 PvP matches without the risk of losing your equipment.
Arena Matches are soft capped at 700 Item Power, any IP above this cap will be reduced by 95%.
Arena battles require 1 healer and 4 fighters on each team.
@TUTORIAL_AUTO_LEARN_CONTENT_TEXT:
[icon:LEARNINGPOINTS]Learning Points allow you to accelerate progress in any node on the Destiny Board.
Once a node reaches a certain threshold, you may spend Learning Points, completing the node's current level instantly. The number of Learning Points needed depends on the amount of [icon:FAME]Fame you're compensating for.
[b]With an active[/b] [icon:PREMIUM]Premium subscription, you will be rewarded with Learning Points every day. 
[b]Without[/b] a Premium subscription, you'll have to complete the daily [icon:CHALLENGEPOINTS]Adventurer's Challenge first.
@TUTORIAL_AUTO_RESPEC_CONTENT_1_TEXT:
Once you have reached level 100 in a Combat node, any [icon:FAME]Fame you receive for that node will be automatically converted into [icon:FAMEPOINTS]Combat Fame Credits.
These [icon:FAMEPOINTS]Combat Fame Credits can be spent to progress other combat nodes you aren't as proficient in.
@TUTORIAL_AUTO_RESPEC_CONTENT_1_TITLE: Take Control of your Combat Fame!
@TUTORIAL_AUTO_RESPEC_CONTENT_2_TEXT:
[b]Without Auto-Respec[/b] active, you will only convert 20% of the [icon:FAME]Fame you earn.
[b]With Auto-Respec[/b] enabled, you can earn 4 times as many [icon:FAMEPOINTS]Combat Fame Credits while spending [icon:SILVER]Silver.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_BIOME1_TEXT1_INFO:
[b]Birch Trees[/b] can be recognized by their white bark and yellow leaves.
Trees of a higher tier have different bark and leaf colors.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_BIOME1_TEXT2_INFO:
[b]Foxes[/b] are small animals with red fur, mainly roaming the forests on their own.
Hide can be gathered from any wild, fur-bearing animal.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_BIOME2_TEXT1_INFO:
[b]Copper Ore[/b] can be recognized by the brown-tinted crystals breaking through the ground.
Ore of a higher tier can be identified by the number and the tint of the crystals.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_BIOME2_TEXT2_INFO:
[b]Cotton[/b] is a light-brown-leafed bush with white buds.
Fiber flourishes close to other plants or water, and can be identified by the color of the leaves.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_CARRYWEIGHT_TEXT1_INFO:
The number beneath your inventory icon shows how much of your carry capacity is being used.
The more you go over 100%, the slower you will move.

The ring around your inventory icon shows how much of your carry capacity is being used.
The redder the ring becomes, the slower you will move.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_CARRYWEIGHT_TEXT2_INFO:
There are various ways to increase your carry capacity.
Bags, mounts, food, and passives on shoes can let you carry more.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_CARRYWEIGHT_TEXT2_TITL: How can I increase my carry capacity?
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_CRAFTING_TEXT1_INFO:
Nearly every item in Albion was crafted by a player.
Armor, weapons, mounts, bags, capes, potions, food, and more.
There is always a need for new equipment, tools, and accessories.
Crafting can be a highly profitable profession.
As long as players keep dying, there will be demand!
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_END_OF_TUTORIAL_TEXT1_:
You have completed all Tutorial Quests.
You can now join other players in the sandbox of Albion Online.
Gather, craft, conquer, and tell your story!
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_EXPEDITIONS_TEXT1_INFO:
Several Expeditions are available at each tier.
There are daily rewards for finishing your first Expedition each day.
Expedition rewards are moderate compared to open-world rewards.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_EXPEDITIONS_TEXT2_INFO:
You can register for Group Expeditions as a solo player. You will be automatically matched with others to form a group.
Hardcore Expeditions are for full groups of 5 and can be level 1-18: the higher the level, the harder the content.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FAMEBOOK_TEXT1_INFO:
Tomes of Insight are old volumes written by past adventurers.
Using these Tomes adds Fame to your equipped gear.
Make sure to equip the gear you want to level before opening a Tome!
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FAMEBOOK_TEXT1_TITLE: You received a Tome of Insight
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FIBER_TEXT1_INFO:
You can recognize Cotton by its two white buds and orange-brown leaves.
The number of buds shows you which tier a fiber resource is.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FIBER_TEXT2_INFO:
Fiber only grows in swamps, steppes, and mountains.
Fiber grows close to water, so look near lakes, rivers and watering holes.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FIBER2_TEXT1_INFO: As Flax is a Tier 3 fiber, it has 3 white buds.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FIBER2_TEXT2_INFO:
Progressing in any gathering path unlocks better tools.
A tool can gather resources up to one tier above its own.
Gathering enchanted resources requires a tool of the same base tier as the resource.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FOCUS_TEXT1_INFO:
Focus is generated over time if you have Premium status.
You can see your current Focus and Focus Regeneration in your stats.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_FOCUS_TEXT2_INFO:
Crafting transforms materials into items.
Focus returns some of your invested materials.
This lets you craft more with less!
Using Focus is one of the main ways to make crafting a very profitable profession.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_GUILDS_TEXT1_INFO:
Guilds are great way to find players that are similar to you.
Find a guild that suits your ambitions.
You can use the Guild Finder or the /lfg chat channel.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_GUILDS_TEXT2_INFO:
There are many activities specifically designed for guilds:
Territory fights...
Castle sieges...
Hideouts...
And of course, Guild Seasons.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_HIDE_TEXT1_INFO:
Rugged Hide can be gathered from any Tier 2 animal.
Different animals on the same tier will all give the same type of hide.
Animals vary by biome: forests have Tier 2 foxes, swamps have Tier 2 snakes, and so on.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_HIDE_TEXT2_INFO:
While Tier 1 hide can be found everywhere, higher-tier hide is found only in steppes, forests, and swamps.
Animals behave differently: some roam in herds, while others patrol the wilderness alone.
Most animals will avoid busy roads.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_HIDE2_TEXT1_INFO: Thin Hide can be gathered from any Tier 3 animal.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_HIDE2_TEXT2_INFO:
Progressing in any gathering path unlocks better tools.
A tool can gather resources up to one tier above its own.
Gathering enchanted resources requires a tool of the same base tier as the resource.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INFO1_TEXT1_INFO:
[b]High Defense, Low Damage Bonus[/b]
Plate armor pieces add [b]Resilience and Crowd Control[/b] to an armor setup.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INFO1_TEXT2_INFO:
[b]Sword:[/b] Melee damage with interrupts and a big finisher attack.
[b]Unlocks:[/b] Swords, Hammers, Maces, Crossbows, Axes, Shields
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INFO2_TEXT1_INFO:
[b]Medium Defense , Medium Damage Bonus[/b]
Leather armor pieces add [b]survivability, Attack Speed, and Cooldown Reduction[/b] to an armor setup.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INFO2_TEXT2_INFO:
[b]Bow:[/b] Consistent ranged damage, staying mobile with exploding and piercing arrows.
[b]Unlocks:[/b] Bows, Daggers, Druid Staffs, Spears, Quarterstaffs, Torches
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INFO3_TEXT1_INFO:
[b]Low Defense, High Damage Bonus[/b]
Cloth armor pieces add [b]damage bonuses and cast speed bonuses[/b] to an armor setup.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INFO3_TEXT2_INFO:
[b]Fire Staff:[/b] Big bursts of damage, longer casting times, with fireballs and ignites.
[b]Unlocks:[/b] Holy, Arcane, Cursed, Fire, and Ice Staffs; Books
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INTERACTION_TEXT1_INFO:
The [b]Dynamic Action[/b] button can be found at the edge of your skill dial by default.
It will switch functions depending on what is closest to you.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INTERACTION_TEXT1_TITL: One button to rule them all
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_INTERACTION_TEXT2_INFO:
Dynamic Actions allow you to perform interactions with the world around you, such as gathering resources, opening loot, fishing or starting conversations.
You can optionally integrate Dynamic Actions into the large attack button in the center of the skill dial.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ISLAND_TEXT1_INFO:
An island is your own private home.
You can build houses, raise animals, plant crops, and hire laborers.
You can even invite friends to visit.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ISLAND_TEXT2_INFO:
You can upgrade your island at the Island Merchant.
Upgrading unlocks more space for farm plots, houses, and crafting stations.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ITEM_TEXT1_INFO:
Tiers dictate the base power of the item.
Tiers range from T1 to T8.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ITEM_TEXT2_INFO: Each enchantment level increases the power of the weapon by 1 tier.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ITEM_TEXT3_INFO:
The frame shows the quality of a weapon.
Each quality level slightly increases the weapon's power.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_JOYSTICK_CONTROLS_TEXT:
Pressing the [b]Attack Button[/b] or an offensive spell will [b]auto-target[/b] the closest enemy in range.
Press the [b]Target Button[/b] next to it to cycle through available targets.

[b]Drag[/b] ground-targeted spells or skillshots to [b]manually target[/b].
[b]Release[/b] to cast
...or release on the [b]area marked with X[/b] to cancel.
[b]TIP:[/b] This also works while moving with the joystick!

[b]Drag[/b] spells or the attack button to [b]manually target[/b].
[b]Release[/b] to cast or select your target.

...or release on the [b]area marked with X[/b] to cancel.
[b]TIP:[/b] This also works while moving with the joystick!

The [b]Action Button[/b] will change its function depending on what interactions can be performed nearby.
Use it to [b]gather, collect, talk[/b] and even [b]fish[/b]!

Move your character by dragging the Virtual Joystick located at the bottom left of the screen.
The joystick centers on your initial touch position.

[b]Thumb Control Layout[/b] 
Move by dragging a [b]Virtual Joystick[/b]
[b]Auto-Targeting[/b] of enemies - [b]Drag Spells[/b] around their button to target manually
[b]Context-based interactions[/b] with the world around you

[b]Classic Tap/Mouse Layout[/b]
Move by tapping where you want to go, similar to mouse clicks
Interact with the world by tapping on objects
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_OPENWORLD_TEXT1_INFO:
The open world offers a plethora of different activities.
There are chests, dungeons, mob camps, world bosses, and much more.
As the open world is more dangerous than Expeditions, it offers greater overall rewards.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_OPTIONS_TEXT1_INFO:
From this point on, there are only a few optional quests to guide you - the world of Albion is a sandbox, where you make your own destiny.
Become a gatherer, warrior, farmer, or anything else you desire.
Focusing on one thing at a time will help you succeed. 
As you progress along a given path, you'll unlock new skills and find it easier to earn Silver.
Now it's time to explore the world of Albion!
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ORE_TEXT1_INFO:
Copper Ore has two crystals that are tinted light brown at the base. 
The number of crystals shows you the tier of the ore.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ORE_TEXT2_INFO:
Ore can only be found in steppes, mountains, and highlands.
Look for it near bigger rock formations such as cliffs, boulders, and hills.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ORE2_TEXT1_INFO: Tin Ore has three crystals, marking it as a Tier 3 resource.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_ORE2_TEXT2_INFO:
Progressing in any gathering path unlocks better tools.
A tool can gather resources up to one tier above its own.
Gathering enchanted resources requires a tool of the same base tier as the resource.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_PREMIUM_TEXT1_TEXT:
In Albion Online, characters can be upgraded to [icon:PREMIUM] Premium status.
Upgraded characters benefit in a wide variety of ways. 
This includes faster game progression, higher yield of rewards, and the ability to use some features that are not available to non-Premium players.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_PREMIUM_TEXT1_TEXT_MOB:
In Albion Online, characters can be upgraded to [icon:PREMIUM] Premium status.
Upgraded characters benefit in a wide variety of ways. 
This includes faster game progression, higher yield of rewards, and the ability to use some features that are not available to non-Premium players.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_PREMIUM_TEXT1_TEXT2: Upgraded characters benefit in a wide variety of ways. This includes faster game progression, higher yield of rewards, and the ability to use some features that are not available to non-Premium players.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_PREMIUM_TEXT2_TEXT: Upgrade your character to [icon:PREMIUM] Premium by spending [icon:SILVER] Silver or [icon:GOLD] Gold on the Premium status screen or buying Premium packs in the Albion Store.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_PREMIUM_TEXT2_TEXT_MOB: Upgrade your character to [icon:PREMIUM] Premium by spending [icon:SILVER] Silver or [icon:GOLD] Gold on the Premium status screen or buying Premium packs in the Albion Store.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_REAVER_TEXT1_INFO:
Defeat mobs to increase your Reaver Tier.
Each tier increases your damage and defense against mobs of that level.
Fighting mobs of levels above your own will be very difficult.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_SILVER_TEXT_INFO: Craft or buy your gear - however many pieces you craft or buy is your decision.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_SILVER_TEXT1_INFO:
[b]Check[/b] what you need to craft your gear
[b]Gather[/b] resources in the forest or mountains
[b]Buy[/b] resources from the Marketplace
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_SILVER_TEXT2_INFO:
[b]Check[/b] the prices of your desired equipment pieces
[b]Defeat[/b] enemies to get more [icon:SILVER] silver
[b]Sell[/b] items at the Marketplace to get more [icon:SILVER] silver
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_STATIC_DUNGEON_TEXT1_I:
Some Dungeons have Camps around them.
These Dungeons are visible on the Minimap and World Map.
Enemies in these Dungeons and Camps grow stronger the longer they live.
These Dungeons and Camps are group content.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_STATIC_DUNGEON_TEXT2_I:
In the world of Albion you will find Solo, Group, and Raid content.
Solo is for single players, Group is for parties of 2-5, and Raid is for 7 or more.
Group and Raid enemies are much tougher, but also give more Fame and rewards.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_STONE_TEXT1_INFO:
Limestone is a light-brown stone.
Stone can be identified by color and height: the taller the stone, the higher the tier.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_STONE_TEXT2_INFO:
While Tier 1 stone can be found everywhere, higher-tier stone is found only in highlands, mountains, and forests.
Stone breaks the surface close to bigger rock formations such as cliffs, boulders, and hills.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_STONE2_TEXT2_INFO:
Progressing in any gathering path unlocks better tools.
A tool can gather resources up to one tier above its own.
Gathering enchanted resources requires a tool of the same base tier as the resource.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_STUDY_TEXT1_INFO:
You can progress your crafting by creating the same item repeatedly.
You can also study your crafted items.
Studying items grants a large amount of Fame.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_STUDY_TEXT2_INFO:
You can study your crafted items at any building where you crafted the item.
This will consume the item but will award you a great boost in Fame.
If you don't immediately need the Silver, this is a great way to progress.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_T3_GEAR_TEXT1_INFO:
Unlocking a Tier 3 weapon node gives you access to additional items from that line.
There are numerous weapon options in the Hunter, Mage, and Warrior lines.
Try out various weapons and see what suits you best!
As always, you can buy items from the marketplace or craft them yourself.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_T3_GEAR_TEXT1_TITLE: You have unlocked new weapon types
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_USE_TEXT1_INFO:
Usable items are activated by clicking a "Use" button.
Dungeon Maps reveal the entrance to a dungeon.
Tomes of Insight grant Fame.
These are just a few examples of usable items.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_USE_TEXT2_INFO:
Open the detail window of the item in your inventory.
Click the "Use" button.
The item will be consumed and will disappear from your inventory.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_WAMF_TEXT_INFO:
You are currently in the [b]tutorial area[/b].
If you are playing with friends, they might be in a different tutorial area.
Some interactions are blocked during the tutorial.
At the end of this tutorial you will be able to choose your starting point in Albion. You can use this as an opportunity to meet up with your friends.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_WHAT_CAN_I_GATHER_TEXT:
Every weapon, piece of armor, and building was at one point a player-gathered resource.
You can gather Fiber, Hide, Stone, Ore and Wood.
To master gathering, focus on one or two resources that are found in the same biome.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_WHATYOUWEAR_TEXT1_INFO:
Combining different armor and weapon types is the pillar of [b]Albion Online's Classless System[/b].

Adjust your gear to best suit your [b]playstyle, party role or task.[/b]

[b]You truly are what you wear.[/b]
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_WOOD_TEXT1_INFO:
Birches have orange-brown leaves and white bark.
Other tiers of tree have different-colored leaves and bark.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_WOOD_TEXT2_INFO:
While Tier 1 trees can be found everywhere, higher-tier trees grow only in forests, swamps, and highlands.
Trees grow in groups, so if you find one you'll most likely find a few.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_WOOD2_TEXT1_INFO: Chestnut Trees have green-blue leaves and brown bark.
@TUTORIAL_BIGHINT_WOOD2_TEXT2_INFO:
Progressing in any gathering path unlocks better tools.
A tool can gather resources up to one tier above its own.
Gathering enchanted resources requires a tool of the same base tier as the resource.
@TUTORIAL_BLACK_MARKET_HOW_TEXT:
When a creature drops an Item as loot, the item is provided from the Black Market's own stock.
An item can be sold for more Silver if the Black Market is short of that item.
@TUTORIAL_BLACK_MARKET_WHAT_TEXT:
The Black Market is an essential component of Albion Online's player-driven economy.
Instead of selling your items to other players, you can directly sell craftable items such as Armor, Weapons, Accessories and Tools to the Black Market Merchant.
@TUTORIAL_CONTROLS_CHANGE_2023_LOCK_CONT:
Targets are no longer always locked by default.
Your target may now change if your currently selected target is not locked and a better one is found. Priorities can be configured in the settings.
You can [b]lock and unlock targets[/b] by manually selecting them or pressing [b][hotkey:ToggleTargetSelection][/b].
Locked targets will be marked by an arrow above them.
You can change this behavior in the settings.
@TUTORIAL_CONTROLS_CHANGE_2023_LOCK_MOBI:
Targets are no longer always locked by default.
Your [b]target may now change[/b] if your currently selected target is not locked and a better one is found. Priorities [b]can be configured in the settings[/b].
You can [b]lock a target[/b] by pressing the targeting button or dragging the Attack button.
Locked targets will be marked by an arrow above them.
You can change this behavior in the settings.
@TUTORIAL_CONTROLS_CHANGE_2023_OTHER:
(Setting) Attack and spell ranges and targets will be previewed while their button is pressed.
(Setting) Beneficial spells will now be cast on self if no other valid target is found within range.
(Setting) Certain spells and actions that do not require targeting can now be triggered immediately on button press
@TUTORIAL_CRYSTAL_ARENA_RANKS_TEXT:
Every Player participating in the Crystal Arena has a Rank based on their Rank Points (RP)
Match rewards are based on Rank, so ranking up will increase your reward yield.
Win matches to gain RP and rank up, and receive valuable rank up rewards.
Losing matches will result in a loss of RP and can ultimately lead to a downrank.
At the beginning of each Guild Season, all Crystal Arena Ranks are reset to Iron I.
@TUTORIAL_CRYSTAL_ARENA_RULES_TEXT:
Each team starts with 150 points.
Matches are won by reducing the opponent's points to zero.
Every 120s, holding more Runestones than your opponent will reduce their points, depending on the discrepancy (20 points for 1 stone; 30 points for 2 stones; 40 points for 3 stones).
The scoring team's Runestones reset to neutral each cycle.
Runestones are captured by a long channel that can be interrupted by enemies.
Reduce your opponent's points further by killing players (6 points per kill) and successfully capturing Runestones (1 point).
@TUTORIAL_CRYSTAL_ARENA_RULES_V2_TEXT:
Each team starts with 150 points.
Matches are won by reducing the opponent's points to zero.
Every 120s, holding more Runestones than your opponent will reduce their points, depending on the discrepancy (20 points for 1 stone; 30 points for 2 stones; 40 points for 3 stones).
The scoring team's Runestones reset to neutral each cycle.
Runestones are captured by a long channel that can be interrupted by enemies.
Reduce your opponent's points further by killing players (6 points per kill) and successfully capturing Runestones (1 point).
@TUTORIAL_CRYSTAL_ARENA_SIGN_UP_TEXT:
The Crystal Arena allows you to fight ranked 5v5 PvP matches without the risk of losing your equipment.
Crystal Arena Matches are soft capped at 900 Item Power; any IP above this cap will be reduced by 80%.
Crystal Arena matches require 1 healer and 4 fighters on each team.
@TUTORIAL_CRYSTAL_ARENA_SIGN_UP_TITLE: Signing up for the Crystal Arena
@TUTORIAL_GUILD_JOIN_CHAT_TEXT:
Each guild has a private guild chat only accessible to guild members.
To access guild chat, select it with the button next to the chat input or type /g in the chat input.
@TUTORIAL_GUILD_JOIN_DISCORD_TEXT:
Many guilds use voice chat services like Discord to communicate.
If they have linked their Discord server here you can use the Discord button below to join the server now.
@TUTORIAL_GUILD_JOIN_MEMBER_MAIL_TEXT:
Some guilds send a welcome message to new members. 
Keep an eye out for this in your mailbox, as there may be instructions on what to do next.
@TUTORIAL_GUILD_JOIN_TITLE: You've joined a guild... what now?
@TUTORIAL_KILL_EMOTE_INFO_CHARGES_TEXT:
Certain charges can be purchased with Gold in the preview.
Items that grant charges can be obtained from Community Chests or purchased at the Marketplace.
@TUTORIAL_KILL_EMOTE_INFO_WHAT_ARE_TEXT:
Select a visual effect that will spawn on your opponent after you deliver the fatal blow.
A selected Victory Emote will automatically trigger as long as it has charges remaining.
You can also choose for them to be triggered when you knock down an opponent.
@TUTORIAL_LOCAL_QUESTS_INFO_MAP_TEXT:
Larger objectives are always visible on the minimap.
Every Mists region may contain multiple smaller camps; however, these are visible on the minimap only after having been discovered.
@TUTORIAL_LOCAL_QUESTS_INFO_WHAT_ARE_TEX:
Local Objectives reward you for engaging in PvE in certain areas of the Mists.
Complete the objectives to gain bonus Fame and Standing with Brecilien. Objectives in the Lethal Mists also award Might and Favor.
@TUTORIAL_MARKETPLACE_MAIN_FIRST_TEXT:
Each city in Albion has its own local Marketplace, meaning there can be a different supply and different prices per city.
All trades at the Marketplace are conducted by players.
@TUTORIAL_MARKETPLACE_MAIN_SECOND_TEXT:
Use the Search and Filter options at the top of the screen to find the items you're looking for.
Search and Filter settings persist when changing tabs in the Marketplace.
@TUTORIAL_MARKETPLACE_ORDERS_BUY_TEXT:
Instead of directly buying, often at a higher price, you can also set up a Buy Order via the [b]Create Buy Order[/b] tab.
Here you can select how many of a given item you want to buy and the price per item.
You pay the full Silver total upon creating the order; if the order is canceled, any remaining Silver is refunded.
@TUTORIAL_MARKETPLACE_ORDERS_GENERAL_TEX:
Instead of fulfilling existing orders, you can set up your own Buy or Sell Orders for a setup fee.
An order is active until it is either completely fulfilled or 30 days have passed, at which point it is automatically canceled.
All items from canceled or fulfilled orders are stored in the [b]Completed Transactions[/b] tab.
If not claimed within 60 days, they are deleted.
When setting up an order, you can use the flyout button of the Action Menu to see the selected item's market history.
@TUTORIAL_MARKETPLACE_ORDERS_SELL_TEXT:
You can set up a Sell Order via the corresponding button in the Action Menu.
Money is directly transferred to you upon the sale of any part of this order.
The same transaction tax applies as if you were selling directly.
@TUTORIAL_MARKETPLACE_TRADING_BUY_TEXT:
You can purchase items via the [b]Buy[/b] tab.
Purchased Items can be retrieved from the Completed Transactions tab, where they are stored for 60 days before being deleted.
@TUTORIAL_MARKETPLACE_TRADING_SELL_TEXT:
In the [b]Sell[/b] tab you can sell any item with 100% durability from your inventory, provided another player has set up a Buy Order for this item.
A transaction tax is paid when selling an item.
@TUTORIAL_MESSAGE_ITEM_SPELL_SELECTION:
Item Abilities
The item you have just equipped has a choice of abilities. After closing this message, you can use the ability selection on the right to configure your item's abilities.

You can change your selection at a later time by clicking on the item in your inventory.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_CORRUPTED_DUNGEONS_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by defeating an opponent during invasions in Stalker and Slayer difficulty dungeons.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_CRYSTAL_LEAGUE_TEXT:
Gain [icon:MIGHT] by slaying opponents in Crystal League matches, as well as part of the final match rewards.
Higher level matches award higher amounts of [icon:MIGHT].
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_CRYSTAL_SPIDERS_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by slaying Crystal Spiders spread across the world of Albion.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_ENERGY_CRYSTALS_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by capturing Energy Crystals and delivering them safely to your Territory.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_GATHERING_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by gathering or fishing in the Outlands or the Roads of Avalon
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_HELLGATES_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by defeating opponents in lethal Hellgates.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_OUTLAND_TREASURES_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by opening treasure chests in the Outlands.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_POWER_CORES_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by capturing Power Cores and delivering them safely to your Hideout.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_PVE_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by helping slay enemies in the Outlands or Roads of Avalon.
@TUTORIAL_MIGHT_SIPHONING_MAGES_TEXT: Gain [icon:MIGHT] by slaying an enemy guild's Siphoning Mages.
@TUTORIAL_PVP_BLACK_HELP_TEXT:
Groups larger than 10 players are displayed on the minimap as red circles.
Attacking other players applies the Outlaw debuff, preventing the attacker from entering Cities or Hideouts for 3 minutes.
@TUTORIAL_PVP_BLACK_LETHAL_TEXT:
In [icon:CLUSTER_BLACK] Black regions, all players are hostile and can attack and kill you (except for players in your party/guild/alliance).
If you are killed by another player, all items on your character are either dropped as loot or destroyed.
@TUTORIAL_PVP_RED_HELP_TEXT:
The number of hostile players is displayed at the bottom of your minimap to the left of the zone name. 
Groups larger than 10 players are displayed on the minimap as red circles.
Non-hostile players gain a defensive buff against hostile players based on their reputation.
Hostile players lose reputation by attacking non-hostile players and gain the Outlaw debuff, preventing them from entering Cities for 3 minutes.
@TUTORIAL_PVP_RED_LETHAL_TEXT:
In [icon:CLUSTER_RED] Red regions, hostile flagged players (red nametags) can attack and kill other players, but can also be attacked themselves.
If you are killed by another player, all items on your character are either dropped as loot or destroyed.
@TUTORIAL_PVP_YELLOW_HELP_TEXT:
The number of hostile players is displayed at the bottom of your minimap to the left of the zone name. 
Groups larger than 10 players are displayed on the minimap as red circles.
Non-hostile players gain a defensive buff against hostile players based on their reputation.
Hostile players lose reputation by attacking non-hostile players and gain the Outlaw debuff, preventing them from entering Cities for 3 minutes.
@TUTORIAL_PVP_YELLOW_NONLETHAL_TEXT:
In [icon:CLUSTER_YELLOW] Yellow regions, hostile flagged players (red nametags) can attack and knock down other players, but can also be attacked themselves.
All items on your character are safe when you are knocked down, and you get up again after a short time.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_DISMOUNT_TEXT:
Mounted players cannot use their spells.
Dismounting next to a player also causes all spells to go on a 5-second cooldown and disables normal attacks.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_EQUIPMENT_TEXT:
In Albion Online, you will die eventually.
Only use equipment you can afford to replace easily when entering a Red or Black Region, so you don't lose your entire savings in a single death.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_INSPECT_TEXT:
You can inspect nearby players by selecting them and pressing Y to see their equipped items and Item Power.
Item Power is a good quick indicator of their strength relative to yours.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_INVISIBILITY_TEX:
Invisibility shrines are available at the exits of all Outland Cities, before traveling into the dangerous Black Zones.
You can use these shrines to hide your direction of travel until you reach the slightly calmer areas further away from the portals.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_MOUNT_TEXT:
Your mount makes survival significantly easier, so staying on or close to it is important.
Clicking on the mount is a faster way of mounting up than resummoning it.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_OVERLOADED_TEXT:
Exceeding you Max Load slows you down, to an eventual standstill.
Keep in mind that all the loot in the world is worth nothing if you can't safely transport it home.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_PROTECTION_TEXT:
When entering a new zone, you are protected by a shield that absorbs all damage and makes you immune to spells.
This shield breaks when interacting with world objects, monsters, or players, when moving too far from the entrance, or after 30 seconds - whichever comes first.
After gaining a shield, you cannot get another one for 60 seconds. Moving far enough from the entrance removes the cooldown.
@TUTORIAL_SURVIVAL_TIPS_RUN_TEXT: Fleeing is often the best strategy when encountering other players whose intentions are unclear.
@TUTORIAL_TRAVEL_FOREST_DESC:
A small settlement in the forest. Known for plentiful wood, hide and stone resources.
Closest settlement to Lymhurst, the Royal City of the Forest.
@TUTORIAL_TRAVEL_HIGHLAND_DESC:
A settlement on the rocky high plains of Albion. This area is known for its huge stone, ore and wood resources.
Closest settlement to Martlock, the Royal City of the Highlands.
@TUTORIAL_TRAVEL_MOUNTAIN_DESC:
Withstanding the cold of the mountain, this settlement is known for ore, stone and fiber.
Closest settlement to Fort Sterling, the Royal City of the Mountains.
@TUTORIAL_TRAVEL_STEPPE_DESC:
Proudly withstanding the heat of the steppe, this settlement is known for its hide, fiber and ore.
Closest settlement to Bridgewatch, the Royal City of the Steppe.
@TUTORIAL_TRAVEL_SWAMP_DESC:
Damp and dark, this small swamp settlement is known
for its vast amounts of fiber, hide and wood.
Closest settlement to Thetford, the Royal City of the Swamp.
@TUTORIAL_YOU_DIED_INFO_DONT_WORRY_TEXT:
Dying and losing your equipment is a common occurrence in the dangerous world of Albion.
The important thing is to get back up on your feet.
@TUTORIAL_YOU_DIED_INFO_LOST_EQUIPMENT_T:
Whenever you die, a temporary Loadout is created, based on your lost equipment.
This temporary Loadout can be directly purchased at the Marketplace or re-equipped from any bank or chest.
Additionally, you can save it permanently in your personal Loadouts.
@UI_ESTIMATED_MARKET_VALUE_TOOLTIP:
Market Value is estimated with average trade numbers from Royal Continent marketplaces.
[b]Prices may vary in different locations![/b]
@UNLOCK_ITEM_NO_UNLOCK_FEEDBACK: You already own the unlock this item grants.
@UNLOCK_ITEM_PARTIALLY_UNLOCK_REQUEST: You already have at least one of the unlocks this item grants. Are you sure you want to use this unlock item? This will consume the item permanently and grant you the corresponding unlocks. This process is irreversible.
@UNLOCK_ITEM_UNLOCK_REQUEST: Are you sure you want to use this unlock item? This will consume the item permanently and grant you the corresponding unlocks. This process is irreversible.

@UPGRADEITEMENCHANTMENT_TEXT_INFO: Runes, souls and relics can be used to add or upgrade enchantments, which increases item power.
@UPGRADEITEMENCHANTMENT_USAGE_FEE_INFO:

@USE_PORTAL_ENTRANCE_ERROR_RESTRICTION_M: You can only use the portal in Martlock.
@USE_PORTAL_ENTRANCE_ERROR_RESTRICTION_T: You can only use the portal in Thetford.
@USECOST_INFO_TEXT: These fees will be charged to people who craft using your crafting station. You are able to set up different fees for associates or users.
@USEHELLGATE_ERROR_NOT_STABLE_TO_ENTER: {0} is not stable and you are not able to enter
@USETELEPORTSTONE_ERROR_NOT_IN_USE: Sorry, teleport stone is not in use
@VANITY_CONSUMABLE_CHARGES_FEATURE_DISAB: Vanity consumables are disabled at the moment, so using items will not grant additional charges and your charges won't be displayed correctly. We are working on fixing this.
@VANITY_UI_CUSTOMIZATION_CLOSE_WARNING: Closing the Preview will cause all selections to be lost. Proceed?
@VANITY_UI_CUSTOMIZATION_CLOSE_WARNING_F:
Closing the Preview has caused all selections to be lost.
Apply your selections in the Preview window to confirm them.

The number of charges determines how often this emote can be played.
Recharge with: {0}
@VANITY_UI_EMOTES_NOTHING_FOUND: No emotes match your filter criteria.
@VANITY_UI_EMOTES_SMART_CLUSTER_QUEUE_WA: Victory Emotes will not trigger in a zone with an active cluster queue!
@VANITY_UI_IN_COMBAT_WARNING: You cannot customize your character while in combat.
@VANITY_UI_PREVIEW_DESC: Changing the selection on the left will automatically update this preview.
@VANITY_UI_PREVIEW_EMOTE_ADVERTISEMENT: Earn charges by watching featured Content Creators.
@VANITY_UI_PREVIEW_EVERYTHING_OWNED: Congratulations! You own all items shown in the preview.
@VANITY_UI_PREVIEW_EVERYTHING_OWNED_CHAR: You own all items shown in the preview. Apply changes below to confirm your selection.
@VANITY_UI_PREVIEW_LOCKED_ITEM_WARNING: This item can be obtained by using its unlock item.
@VANITY_UI_PREVIEW_LOCKED_STORE: This item can be purchased in the Albion Store
@VANITY_UI_WARDROBE_DROP_EXPLANATION: Drag and drop to equip and unequip
@VETERAN_FOUNDER_MAIL_TEXT:
Thank you for participating in the Albion Online founder program!

We have unlocked your founder rewards, including your Gold reward. You will also find your founder's items in separate messages.

We hope you enjoy your founder's rewards!
 - Your Albion Online team
@VETERAN_FURNITURE_MAIL_TEXT:
Dear Founder,

This message contains your Founder's Certificate. You can use it to let everyone know you were one of the first to set foot in the world of Albion, by displaying your certificate proudly on the wall of your house.

We hope you enjoy your Founder's Certificate!
 - Your Albion Online team

IMPORTANT: Please be aware that items are lost when you die. We will NOT replace items lost or traded away, so please be careful when carrying these items.
@VETERAN_STARTERPACK_MAIL_TEXT:
Dear Player,

Thank you for buying a Veteran Starter Pack for Albion Online!

We have unlocked your Gold and Premium days.

We hope you enjoy your Starter Pack!
- Your Albion Online Team
@WARNING_BIND_TO_PORTAL: Enter {0}? If you don't already have a portal binding, this will bind you to this portal.
@WARNING_MOBILE_PERFORMANCE_IMPACT:
This setting will impact performance and battery life.
Keep anyway?
@WARNING_OPEN_EXTERNAL_WEBSITE: You are about to minimize the game and open an external website. Are you sure?
@WARNING_REMOVE_PORTAL_BINDING: If you remove your portal binding, you will have to wait {0} days before you can remove the binding again. Are you sure you want to proceed?
@WELCOME_TO_ALBION_MAIL_TEXT:
Welcome to Albion!

Your Starter Pack rewards can be claimed via "Claim Rewards" in the Settings menu (the cogwheel symbol in the top right corner of your screen).

Remember that each pack can only be claimed once!

- Your Albion Online team
@WORLD_BOSS_AVALON_MAGE_BOSS_DESC:
The Avalonians are extracting this land's energy. Defeat them to get a large amount of Avalonian Energy and Season Points.

This boss is suited for groups of ten players.
@WORLD_BOSS_KEEPER_DESC: The Keepers have offered large amounts of Silver and other valuable items to their Mother. Claim it against all odds, be it from this ancient folk or other adventurers.
@WORLD_BOSS_MORGANA_DESC: This abomination has hoarded large quantities of Silver and other valuable items.
@WORLD_BOSS_T4_UNDEAD_DESC:
Excavate large quantities of Silver and other valuable items - but be wary of others pursuing the same goal!

This boss is suited for groups of ten players.
@WORLD_BOSS_T5_KEEPER_DESC:
The Keepers have offered large amounts of Silver and other valuable items to their Mother. Claim it against all odds, be it from this ancient folk or other adventurers.

This boss is suited for groups of ten players.
@WORLD_BOSS_T6_MORGANA_DESC:
This abomination has hoarded large quantities of Silver and other valuable items.

This boss is suited for groups of ten players.
@WORLD_BOSS_T7_UNDEAD_DESC:
Excavate large quantities of Silver and other valuable items - but be wary of others pursuing the same goal!

This boss is suited for groups of ten players.
@WORLD_BOSS_T8_MORGANA_DESC:
This fiend has hoarded large quantities of Silver and other valuable items.

This boss is suited for groups of ten players.
@WORLD_BOSS_T8_UNDEAD_DESC:
Excavate large quantities of Silver and other valuable items - but be wary of others pursuing the same goal!

This boss is suited for groups of ten players.
@WORLD_BOSS_UNDEAD_DESC: Excavate large quantities of Silver and other valuable items - but be wary of others pursuing the same goal!
@WORLDBOSS_GUI_MODULE_HEADER_ENEMY_INFO: Expect large numbers of {0} enemies to be gathered here
@WORLDBOSS_GUI_MODULE_INFORMATION_LIST:
This stronghold is home to a powerful World Boss and their most trusted minions.
World Bosses are among the strongest foes found in Albion, and only the bravest groups of adventurers dare challenge them in combat.
Keep in mind that the higher the risk, the higher the potential rewards.
@WORLDMAP_CLUSTER_UI_ESTATES_INFO: Estates are plots of land you can acquire to construct various buildings. You can share or trade them with other players.
@WORLDMAP_CLUSTER_UI_FACTIONS_INFO: Many different native factions populate the continent of Albion, each with their own unique characteristics, strengths and weaknesses.
@WORLDMAP_CLUSTER_UI_MAX_BUILDING_TIER_I: In this area, buildings cannot be built or upgraded above this tier.
@WORLDMAP_CLUSTER_UI_PVP_INFO: There are four different security levels: Safe, Yellow, Red, and Black. In Safe, you cannot attack other players and others cannot loot your corpse for a certain period after death. In Yellow, attacking other players is permitted, but peaceful players receive advantages. In Red, players may attack each other freely without any penalties. In Black, everyone is assumed to be hostile at all times.
@WORLDMAP_CLUSTER_UI_RESOURCES_INFO:
A higher presence of a resource type makes it more likely to find higher tier resources of that type.
Note also the highest tier of any resource present in this area.
@WORLDMAP_DESC_EXIT_DUNGEON_GROUP: This dungeon ({0}) is suitable to be explored by a small group of 3-5 adventurers. Beware: The creatures in this dungeon are lethal!
@WORLDMAP_DESC_EXIT_DUNGEON_RAID: This dungeon ({0}) is suitable to be explored by a large group of 10-12 adventurers. Beware: The creatures in this dungeon are lethal!
@WORLDMAP_DESC_EXIT_DUNGEON_SANDBOX: This dungeon ({0}) offers challenges for solo players and groups. Beware! Mobs in here can be lethal.
@WORLDMAP_DESC_EXIT_DUNGEON_SOLO: This dungeon ({0}) is suitable to be explored by a single adventurer.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_GUILD_BUY: Your guild is able to buy this island at the island vendor on {0} for {1}.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_GUILD_INFO: Guild Islands are islands which you can purchase for your guild to build up and grow crops in. Certain ranks within the guild are able to invite other people to the island.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_GUILD_MOVE: Your guild already owns an island, located just off {0}.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_GUILD_OWNED: Your guild owns an island just offshore here. You can travel there from {0} for free.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_PRIVATE_BUY: You can purchase this island at the island vendor on {0} for {1}.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_PRIVATE_INFO: Private islands are islands which you can purchase for yourself to build up and grow crops in. You are able to invite other people to your island.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_PRIVATE_MOVE: You already own an island, located just off the coast of {0}.
@WORLDMAP_ISLAND_UI_PRIVATE_OWNED: You own an island just offshore here. You can travel there from {0} for free.
@WORLDMAP_MARKER_DESC_CITY_PASSAGE_ENTRA: Travel to the ancient underground catacombs of Caerleon.
@WORLDMAP_MARKER_DESC_DUNGEON_KEEPER_GRO:
In this massive underground chamber, the Keepers live in harmony with their environment.

This dungeon is suited for groups of 4-5 players.
@WORLDMAP_MARKER_DESC_DUNGEON_KEEPER_SOL:
Keepers live in this cave underneath some of their sacred grounds.

This dungeon is suited for solo players.
@WORLDMAP_MARKER_DESC_DUNGEON_MORGANA_GR:
Morgana's followers use this massive fortress as a prison for their captives.

This dungeon is suited for groups of 4-5 players.
@WORLDMAP_MARKER_DESC_DUNGEON_MORGANA_SO:
Morgana's disciples have claimed this giant cave and built a watchtower in this area. 

This dungeon is suited for solo players.
@WORLDMAP_MARKER_DESC_DUNGEON_UNDEAD_GRO:

After the evacuation phase has ended, the attacking Guild will take control of this territory.
@WORLDMAPTERRITORY_ATTACKBONUSFROMMAGES_:
For each 30 Minutes a Siphoning Mage is active in a Territory during the 4 hours before a Prime Time a Guild gains a Battle Bonus of 0.15% in this Territory.
This can stack up to a maximum of 4.8%.
@WORLDMAPTERRITORY_DEFENDERBONUSFROMMAGE:
For each 30 Minutes a Siphoning Mage is active in a Territory during the 4 hours before a Prime Time a Guild gains a Battle Bonus of 0.15% in this Territory.
This can stack up to a maximum of 4.8%. This effect stacks with the Defender Bonus.

Please check your system for any such programs and delete them before restarting the game.
If you do not have any such programs installed, please send a ticket to our customer support at albiononline.com/support for assistance.

@XMAS_2016_MAIL_TEXT:
Fellow Adventurer,
 
Everyone here at Sandbox Interactive wishes you a great holiday and a happy new year!
 
We want to thank you and your friends in Albion for your continuous outstanding support and all your feedback. You are helping us to make the game the best it can be. Thank you!
 
Have some fireworks and snowballs on us, so you can celebrate properly in game as well.
 
We're looking forward to exploring all the great things to come together with you!
 
Your Sandbox Interactive Team
 
PS: Have you found Uncle Frost yet?
@XMAS_2017_MAIL_TEXT:
Fellow Adventurer,

A merry holiday and a happy new year to you!

We at Sandbox Interactive want to thank you for your continuous support; the game would not be what it is today without you.

To celebrate, here are Uncle Frost's Hat and Snowballs to prepare you for the Winter Event! Starting mid-January, these Snowballs can be traded for Winter-themed rewards, including an exclusive Winter 2018 mount. You will also find a new Good Deeds quest to embark on a journey around the Royals; and more special groups and PvP events to come...

We look forward to seeing you in Albion!

Your Sandbox Interactive Team.
@XMAS_2018_MAIL_TEXT:
Fellow Adventurer,

A merry holiday season and a Happy New Year to you!

We at Sandbox Interactive want to thank you for your continued support - the game would not be what it is today without you.

To celebrate, here's a gift of Uncle Frost's Hat and some brand new fireworks.

We look forward to seeing you in Albion!

- Your Sandbox Interactive Team
